story:
En cette période difficile, plusieurs artistes de nos communautés ne peuvent exercer leur métier.

Nous comprenons et respectons cette nécessité imposée par notre gouvernement et sommes de tout coeur avec les victimes et l'entourage des personnes touchées directement par le COVID19.

Cette collecte de fonds a pour but de soutenir les artistes drags de Montréal qui doivent faire face a la fermeture de leurs lieux de travail. 

Une partie importante de la communauté drag n'a pas d'emploi de jour et est confrontée de façon soudaine a cette réalité.

Nous vous proposons donc un spectacle virtuel  mardi 21 AVRIL, 20H animé par Rainbow sur YouTube et possiblement, d'autres événements.  Nous ne manquons pas d'imagination!

Les artistes se sépareront les recettes de cette collecte de fonds. 

Merci de votre support! C'est grandement apprécié.

****

Most self-employed queer artists are facing a difficult road ahead.

We understand and respect the necessities imposed by our government and our hearts go out to the victims and all those affected by COVID 19.

A large portion of our drag community does not have a day job and are now suddenly confronted with a difficult reality.

Our drag community is already hurting financially from the current situation. We therefore invite you to virtually attend our show  Tuesday APRIL 21th at 8 PM on YouTube Live host by Rainbow.

Now is the time to support your local drag performers, so tip generously!

story:
My Summary

My name is Alyscia Cunningham and I am a speaker, author and photographer. In other words, I am an entrepreneur. I was raised with a Caribbean heritage, my parents being from the island of Trinidad & Tobago. My childhood neighborhood was Corona Queens, NY but I now reside in the Washington, DC area with my husband and 3 children.
I recently received exciting news of my acceptance as a speaker with Green Festival in Los Angeles this September 12-14, 2014. 
Green Festival is America’s largest and longest-running sustainability and green living event. They bring together the world’s most trusted companies, innovative brands, national and local businesses, pioneering thinkers, and conscious consumers in one place to promote the best in sustainability and green living. Visit www.GreenFestivals.org for more info.
The topic of my discussion is titled "Embrace Your Natural Beauty" which is the exact message in my book, Feminine Transitions. My book celebrates and promotes the natural beauty of girls and women through unaltered (NO PHOTOSHOP) portraits. All participants were also required to be bare, free of any make-up.
Everyone that knows me personally is very aware that I am and always have been a "green" advocate and supporter. I live green! Well, let me just say I live as green as I possibly could. It's not in any way a cheap lifestyle but the health benefits are priceless. 

The Impact

Feminine Transitions is a social change project. I an elated to participate at the Green Festival where I am able to spread my message and much discussion to over 30,000+ attendees from around the world. 
The media has pretty much bombarded our minds with their "idea" of beauty. I'm giving talks at schools & universities, girl/women empowerment organizations and art galleries creating a shift in the paradigm of our society. 
Your support will help me spread my message on a higher platform.

What I Need & What You Get

I only need $1,500 to help cover my travel expenses from September 11-14. This covers my airfare, accommodations, car rental and food and beverage.

  • I have over 10,000+ followers on my social media campaigns! For as little as $5.00 I will shout you out on the platform of your choice or shout you out on all for $10.00 (Twitter-2,681 following, Facebook-5,233-following, Facebook-3,645 friends, LinkedIn-921 connections and email list-1000+ subscribers)
  • If your live within a 50 mile radius of the DMV area you have the opportunity to have a photo session with me for 50% off my mini session price. 
  • 5% of the sales proceeds from my book, Feminine Transitions is donated to girl/women empowerment organizations. I will also donate 5% of your contribution to this campaign. In turn you are supporting girl/women empowerment. Visit www.FeminineTransitions.com to find about the organization I send donations and your option to donate to an organization of your choice if your purchase a copy of my book.

    Not able to contribute?

    You may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • Get the word out and share this campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools! 
    • Join my email list to keep posted on upcoming projects http://eepurl.com/GEKLr

story:
My Story:

My name is LC Morgan. I am a 21 year old artist aspiring to work my way to Ontario College of Art and Design (OCADU), in Toronto, Canada. I plan to major in Illustration, to achieve my dreams of being a storyboard artist for TV/Film, a portrait artist, and a comic book illustrator. Please feel free to check out my more popular artwork thus far on my website: www.lcmorganart.com. Or click my gallery at the top of the page.

However, my parents' recent divorce has left one parent unable to help support me financially, and one parent unwilling to support my higher education. I have done a lot of freelance artwork in the past two years, as well as creating a commission business to save money for school, but I am still short on funds.

If you ask about an artist from my home town, 9/10 people will know my name. I am a self-taught artist, and have been drawing and writing my own comics since I was 9 years old. By my calculations, I have spent nearly 13,000 hours of my life drawing. On social media, I have a collective 3,000+ fans, followers, and likes.

I am a very accomplished artist for my age: having done artwork for a dozen Olympic Athletes directly, having my artwork recognized by a handful of celebrities, and been promoted multiple times by BBC America for my fan artwork of 'Orphan Black'.

There is nothing I want and need more in my life than to have a chance to go to university. I know that I will succeed in any artistic setting - I just need the chance.

Every contributor to my cause will receive artwork from me. I am willing to draw anything in exchange for your support. Working for my opportunity to go to school is incredibly important to me. You can contact me at lcmorganart@gmail.com.

(LC Morgan, 2014)

What I Need & What You Get:

With my current savings, I am short approximately $10,350 USD for tuition.

If my goal is not entirely met, all money raised will stay safely in my school savings. Regardless of if my goal is met, every contributor will receive artwork of their choice.

If you would like artwork from me in exchange for your contribution, please email me at lcmorganart@gmail.com. My specialty is portrait art, however, I can draw anything. My strongest mediums are pencil, marker, colored pencil, charcoal, digital art, pen & ink, and watercolor paint. You can see examples of these mediums on my website: www.lcmorganart.com.

In your email to me, if you would like a portrait, all you have to do is attach the photo you would like me to draw (the higher quality and larger the image, the better!). If you would like a design or an abstract piece, send me a description or a photo reference if you have one. If you would like any medium in particular, please include that as well. Even more specific, if there is a certain size you would like your piece to be, please state that as well.

*No contributor artwork will be posted on social media, or used in my personal portfolio without the contributor's consent.

(LC Morgan, 2014)

    The Impact:

    There is nothing I want and need more in my life than to have a chance to go to university. I believe I will succeed in any artistic setting - I just need the chance.

    I have done freelance artwork for the past two years, and have a 5-star rating on my Etsy shop. I can guarantee that all contributors will receive their artwork. However, I would appreciate your patience as I will be drawing on a first-contributed, first-served basis.

    (LC Morgan, 2014)

      Risks & Challenges:

      I understand that everything we do in life has risks. Helping raise money for my higher education is most definitely a risk. All I can promise is that if I finally get my chance to attend school, I will make it. Many, many people I know hold the highest faith in me to achieve success in my artistic endeavors. All money will be added to my school savings fund, which will only continue to grow until I have the means to attend school.

      I don't like to take from people, I consider myself much more of a giver. So, my artwork to contributors is my way of paying back. If you do me a service, I will gladly do you a service.

      (LC Morgan, 2014)

        Other Ways You Can Help:

        If you can not contribute, please spread the word of my campaign. It would mean the world to me if you simply shared this page on social media.

        If you would like to directly link a share to my social media, or follow my progress, here are my links:

        www.lcmorganart.com

        www.facebook.com/lcmorganart

        www.lcmorganart.tumblr.com

        www.twitter.com/lcmorgan43

        www.etsy.com/shop/lcmorganart

        Thank you so much for your support.

        (LC Morgan, 2015)

story:
Short Summary

More Than Words is a large scale collaboration "art" project between Stephanie Chapman (Turtleberry Press) and Danielle Reed (Girl Genius). The bulk of this project will be production and print of a black and white coffee table book presenting a photo/documentary of poets.

The idea behind the shoot isn't necessarily the traditional stage pics, but the before, during and after inspiration. We want to try and capture moments or snapshots in the lives of artists. And by "artist,"  we aren't looking at just the full time poet or the biggest name--it's about those who have a passion for poetry above everything. 

Once the book is finalized (projected publication date is April 2014-during National Poetry Month), the best pictures and outtakes will be displayed as part of an interactive art show at galleries in Richmond, DC and Baltimore (details on dates and times TBA). 

About Us:

Danielle Reed aka the Girl Genius is a professional writer/editor and spoken word artist from Virginia

Stephanie Chapman aka Turtleberry is an author/photographer and poet based in Baltimore

What We Need & What You Get

The money from this project is being used to make sure we have a quality book. It'll cover printing costs for both the physical books and gallery prints as well as the costs associated with acquiring gallery space and minimal travel costs involved with the shoot. 

With any contribution, if you are in the area, feel free to attend the gallery debuts. We will post dates and locations for you to come see what we do

Baltimore exhibit date: April 27, 2014 Soulful Emergence Art Gallery

The Impact

We both have a love for spoken word and the community that it embodies. However, poets are real people off stage with real lives--it's where they draw their inspiration. The goal is to show that side--using shots of some of the amazing people we know. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean YOU (yes you,) can’t help:

  • Tell people about this project. A little word goes a long way--poet joke! lol
  • Seriously, share with friends. We believe in supporting the arts and the artists.

story:
Greetings from Kennedy Tukwasiibwe.

Iam a fine art college student from Uganda.

I like very much artwork.I do it as a course as well as source of income to sustain me at college by paying tuition, accommodation, meals, scholastic materials and other basic needs.

This is my campaign. I need your support so I raise funds to purchase materials to carry out my artworks,crafts,baticks and ceramics.

I need at least USD 700 for purchase of materials to enable me do more of the above mentioned.

I always contribute to community and humanity in way of: donating blood,carrying out voluntary activities such as community cleaning.

Kindly share my campaign with others using the indiegogo share tools,through social media,emails and other ways at your disposal.

Contribute using the contribution button on the campaign.

 

Email: kennedytukwasiibwe@gmail.com

story:
It is time to show the world that Nashville is serious about street art. Get on board...keep funding and signing up to add your portrait until the deadline because your face is needed and we will build as many lanterns as we can fund and photograph! 

"The World Hears Nashville, Now They See Us!"

NASHVILLIANS = STREET ART

We have partnered with the Tennessee State Museum to line the streets of Nashville with YOUR portraits for a large scale temporary street art project. Yes, we are turning amazing Nashvillians into art!!

We want to line Deaderick Street with paper lanterns and "illuminate" our citizens during the TEDxNashville event on April 6th, 2013 at the TPAC.

There will be a solor powered light within each of the 3' x 4.5' black and white portrait cubes, to make for a magical April Art Crawl featuring the amazing individuals that make our city great! Join us with your support to help fund the materials and installation and enjoy some awesome rewards such as seeing your face become street art!

MORE = WOW

We currently have 56 portraits and need a minimum of $1200 to fund the build and installation. But that only leaves us with 14 lanterns. Our goal is to have a minimum of 20 lanterns lining the streets, displaying 80+ citizens.

The MORE lanterns, the BETTER! We will build AS MANY AS WE CAN FUND and build by the deadline! The more lanterns we have, the greater we glow...and Nashville is a city that shines!

REWARDS

The rewards are great because we need funding to build these lanterns but we also need more faces to to grow the action, and that is where you come in! You can support art for arts sake, sponsor a lantern and even have the chance to become art! Anyone who contributes $50 or more gets the option of adding their portrait to our current collection and will fund the build and display of yet another lantern! You can even take a lantern home with a contribution of $150 or more!

WHO & WHY

Artists, Kristin Llamas and Alfonso Llamas are working to promote, engage and inspire the visual arts within Music City. Their slogan is "The World Hears Nashville, Now They SEE us." This project, in partnership with the Tennessee State Museum furthers the mission to inspire and be inspired by visual art. It is an official INSIDE OUT by JR global art project and will be documented and shared with the world...we are bringing the world in, while sending Nashville out.

Other INSIDE OUT projects around the world have created a beautiful impact, but Nashville's trasformation is the first of its kind. These sculptural lanterns create a light box effect directly lining the city street. This is Portraiture + Street Art at its core!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can't help!

If you think that this project is inspiring and want to see it happen but just can't contribute, we get it! Help us reach our goal by sharing and spreading the word!

Visit the events page at: www.KLlamas.com, check out Nashville's largest street art installation at www.AKLlamas.com or connect socially at: http://www.facebook.com/KLlamasArt

story:
Art and Music Coming Together in a Whole New Way

One day during my middle school art class, my teacher told the young artists in the room, “The hardest thing for any artist to do, young or old, is find that one thing that helps them stand out among the rest.” I was in my 30s when I realized just how true that statement was. Even when art was nothing more than a hobby of mine, I still yearned to find the niche which made my art unique, my own.

But drawing wasn’t my only passion -- I was also a serious Barbershopper. I am a member of the Barbershop Harmony Society, filled with men that love to sing four-part harmony! Along with the search for my artistic niche, I also wanted to find a way to make a name for myself as a Barbershop singer--not necessarily as a gold medalist or anything equally glamorous. Rather, I wanted to contribute to the Barbershop community in my own unique way--to give something back.

These two desires merged by accident in July of 2015. Like hundreds of others, I watched (via the international contest webcast) Acoustix take the stage for the 25th anniversary of their gold medal win in 1990. From a screenshot I took, I drew a minimalist  illustration of the famous quartet. For sheer fun I posted it on various Barbershop social media groups of which I am a member.

The response was bigger than I had anticipated! Some members even asked me to do more quartet illustrations.

“You should totally draw Main Street!”
“Dude! Instant Classic! Draw them!”
“Forefront would look awesome as a drawing!”

I decided to take the 2015 international quartet champs, Instant Classic, and put together and illustration I felt best represented them. And fellow barbershoppers on Facebook kept asking me when I was going to draw every quartet champion.

And a light bulb came on. This could be my long hoped for niche, and it would allow me to combine both drawing and music in a new and intriguing way!

I excitedly decided to move forward with the project.

Each quartet illustration came with its own set of unique challenges, but some were much harder than others. I typically sketched out three to five concepts before moving forward with what would be the final drawing. At times, I would seek out the opinions of fellow barbershoppers, especially for the older quartet champions of whom I had little to no knowledge. I started this project with more recent quartet champions, but the further back in time I went, the more research was required. Even though I was putting my own spin on their legacy, I spent a lot of time making sure I stayed true to the spirit of each quartet.

With encouragement, I decided to collect these drawings into a book, and I realized that this was my opportunity to give back to the Society. The Harmony Foundation, the philanthropic partner of the BHS, sends representatives everywhere to spread the word about what the society is and to raise money for outreach programs and other activities. They focus especially on younger, up-and-coming singers. As a member of the society, I've always wanted to donate to the Foundation, but never found myself in a position where I could.

I believe the opportunity to do so has finally come. I am giving to the Foundation by selling this book of champion quartet illustrations!

This art project of mine, entitled BHSart, was incredibly fun, but it isn’t over! I plan on doing this for years to come as we add more international champions to our society. I also plan to do illustrations for other barbershop organizations, such as Sweet Adelines, Harmony, Inc., and maybe even the collegiate champions and choruses. The possibilities could keep me going for years, and the potential is exciting! I hope you enjoy this loving tribute to our quartet champions.

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise money for the Harmony Foundation. I do need to recover some of my own costs, but the majority of funds raised will then be donated towards the Harmony Foundation to continue to do the great things they do for the singing community world wide.
I will be traveling to Nashville this coming July for this year's week-long international barbershop quartet and chorus contest. I will have a booth at the convention and will be promoting the project, myself, and selling more BHSart books.
  • $700 is my goal for this fundraising campaign.  It seems like a small amount, but this campaign is just a launchpad. I need to recover some costs of publishing and a few other logistical items. Anything raised after the $700 goal is reached will only help to further this project--allowing for me to bring extra BHSart books to Nashville and give more money to the Harmony Foundation!
  • The incentive packages, listed to the right, can get you a variety of gifts--copies of the book, individual prints, and custom art tailored just for you!
  • To recap: Funds raised through this campaign will go towards helping me recover some of my own costs, but anything after than will go to the Harmony Foundation, which is linked above.
  • Visit my website - Illustratorjimmy - to see all of the quartet champ illustrations that will be in the book.

The Impact

I've found a way to meld my two passions, and I want this to spread! I would love this project to be the inspirational catapult for more barbershoppers to showcase their talents beyond singing within the Society. We tend to forget that our fellow brothers in harmony have lives and interests that extend beyond four-part harmony.

Keeping this hobby alive and well through my talents is also important, and I hope that with your help I can raise money that the Harmony Foundation can use for important outreach programs.

Risks & Challenges

There aren't a lot of risks to be honest. The publisher has been paid and the books are ready to be published! The $700 goal is only to make sure I can get enough books ordered for Nashville, as well as to help me recover some of my own costs. Once the goal is reached, anything beyond is just money in the bank for the Foundation!

I plan to have extra books at my booth in Nashville, but obviously those will be a limited supply, and the number of books I bring will depend on if the goal is reached (which I fully expect it to) and/or if it's exceeded. But if you contribute to this campaign, your copy of the book is guaranteed! 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone can contribute financially. If you can't, then please help by spreading the word. Social media is a great tool for this! Below are the sharing methods you can use.

If you're a chorus member, bring this up at your chorus chapter meeting and tell others who may not know about this project!
story_txt:
Art and Music Coming Together in a Whole New Way

One day during my middle school art class, my teacher told the young artists in the room, “The hardest thing for any artist to do, young or old, is find that one thing that helps them stand out among the rest.” I was in my 30s when I realized just how true that statement was. Even when art was nothing more than a hobby of mine, I still yearned to find the niche which made my art unique, my own.
But drawing wasn’t my only passion -- I was also a serious Barbershopper. I am a member of the Barbershop Harmony Society, filled with men that love to sing four-part harmony! Along with the search for my artistic niche, I also wanted to find a way to make a name for myself as a Barbershop singer--not necessarily as a gold medalist or anything equally glamorous. Rather, I wanted to contribute to the Barbershop community in my own unique way--to give something back.


These two desires merged by accident in July of 2015. Like hundreds of others, I watched (via the international contest webcast) Acoustix take the stage for the 25th anniversary of their gold medal win in 1990. From a screenshot I took, I drew a minimalist  illustration of the famous quartet. For sheer fun I posted it on various Barbershop social media groups of which I am a member.
The response was bigger than I had anticipated! Some members even asked me to do more quartet illustrations.
“You should totally draw Main Street!”“Dude! Instant Classic! Draw them!”“Forefront would look awesome as a drawing!”



I decided to take the 2015 international quartet champs, Instant Classic, and put together and illustration I felt best represented them. And fellow barbershoppers on Facebook kept asking me when I was going to draw every quartet champion.
And a light bulb came on. This could be my long hoped for niche, and it would allow me to combine both drawing and music in a new and intriguing way!
I excitedly decided to move forward with the project.


Each quartet illustration came with its own set of unique challenges, but some were much harder than others. I typically sketched out three to five concepts before moving forward with what would be the final drawing. At times, I would seek out the opinions of fellow barbershoppers, especially for the older quartet champions of whom I had little to no knowledge. I started this project with more recent quartet champions, but the further back in time I went, the more research was required. Even though I was putting my own spin on their legacy, I spent a lot of time making sure I stayed true to the spirit of each quartet.
With encouragement, I decided to collect these drawings into a book, and I realized that this was my opportunity to give back to the Society. The Harmony Foundation, the philanthropic partner of the BHS, sends representatives everywhere to spread the word about what the society is and to raise money for outreach programs and other activities. They focus especially on younger, up-and-coming singers. As a member of the society, I've always wanted to donate to the Foundation, but never found myself in a position where I could.
I believe the opportunity to do so has finally come. I am giving to the Foundation by selling this book of champion quartet illustrations!


This art project of mine, entitled BHSart, was incredibly fun, but it isn’t over! I plan on doing this for years to come as we add more international champions to our society. I also plan to do illustrations for other barbershop organizations, such as Sweet Adelines, Harmony, Inc., and maybe even the collegiate champions and choruses. The possibilities could keep me going for years, and the potential is exciting! I hope you enjoy this loving tribute to our quartet champions.   What We Need & What You Get
My goal is to raise money for the Harmony Foundation. I do need to recover some of my own costs, but the majority of funds raised will then be donated towards the Harmony Foundation to continue to do the great things they do for the singing community world wide.
I will be traveling to Nashville this coming July for this year's week-long international barbershop quartet and chorus contest. I will have a booth at the convention and will be promoting the project, myself, and selling more BHSart books.  $700 is my goal for this fundraising campaign.  It seems like a small amount, but this campaign is just a launchpad. I need to recover some costs of publishing and a few other logistical items. Anything raised after the $700 goal is reached will only help to further this project--allowing for me to bring extra BHSart books to Nashville and give more money to the Harmony Foundation! The incentive packages, listed to the right, can get you a variety of gifts--copies of the book, individual prints, and custom art tailored just for you!
To recap: Funds raised through this campaign will go towards helping me recover some of my own costs, but anything after than will go to the Harmony Foundation, which is linked above.
Visit my website - Illustratorjimmy - to see all of the quartet champ illustrations that will be in the book.



The Impact
I've found a way to meld my two passions, and I want this to spread! I would love this project to be the inspirational catapult for more barbershoppers to showcase their talents beyond singing within the Society. We tend to forget that our fellow brothers in harmony have lives and interests that extend beyond four-part harmony.
Keeping this hobby alive and well through my talents is also important, and I hope that with your help I can raise money that the Harmony Foundation can use for important outreach programs.   Risks & Challenges There aren't a lot of risks to be honest. The publisher has been paid and the books are ready to be published! The $700 goal is only to make sure I can get enough books ordered for Nashville, as well as to help me recover some of my own costs. Once the goal is reached, anything beyond is just money in the bank for the Foundation!
I plan to have extra books at my booth in Nashville, but obviously those will be a limited supply, and the number of books I bring will depend on if the goal is reached (which I fully expect it to) and/or if it's exceeded. But if you contribute to this campaign, your copy of the book is guaranteed! 
    Other Ways You Can Help I understand that not everyone can contribute financially. If you can't, then please help by spreading the word. Social media is a great tool for this! Below are the sharing methods you can use.
If you're a chorus member, bring this up at your chorus chapter meeting and tell others who may not know about this project!

story:
Who we are

Abood Aladham

Abood is the founder of the very first beatbox battle in Jordan. After falling in love with beatbox in 2010, Abood taught himself how to practice the art, but found no space to hone his skills or meet and compete with other beatboxers. So he decided to create the King of the Beat in 2014 which brought together all the active beatboxers of Jordan in one competition. The event was a success and Abood found that he had united a large beatbox community in one space.

Abood, at just 22 years of age, is already an accomplished and talented beatboxer who has done numerous shows around the country, appeared on TV and radio shows, and has his own fan base. He is well known in Amman’s Hip Hop underground and the city’s wider arts scene. Abood is also an active member in the arts scene as part of Studio 8, an arts and dance collective.


While the King of the Beat and Beatbox Unlimited competitions have been popular and successful, they have relied on the goodwill and generosity of the people who made the event happen. Reputable artists have kindly offered to judge, MC, perform and support in a variety of ways for free. Although this is a show of support from the Hip Hop scene, it does little to remedy the lack of financial support and sponsorship given to artists.

Too many events, festivals and activities in Jordan expect grassroots artists to perform and work for very little money to no pay at all – while they pay astonishing amounts of money to import artists from outside! Abood wants to change this and run a competition where local talent is paid for their art. He has started to make this change within his own community of beatboxers.


Changing social views of beatboxing

While Hip Hop is moderately frowned upon in Jordan, things are far worse for Beatboxers. Often places which host shows and events will draw the line at beatboxing, excluding an entire community of youth with dedication and promising talent and depriving them of opportunities to develop their art.

The exclusion is worse for female beatboxers. Not only is the beatbox community male dominated, but traditional Jordanian society considers it shameful for young girls to perform on stage. This is something the King of the Beat is actively trying to change. Abood Aladham has gone to extraordinary lengths to mentor and support the first and only female Jordanian beatboxer Sara, in spite of family opposition. Sara competed in the King of the Beat 2015 and gave her first ever solo performance during Beatbox Unlimited, an event that incorporated musicians, dancers, and other performers into beatboxing performances. Originally, Sara had a teammate to compete in Beatbox Unlimited, a young female vocalist. However the girl was removed from the event by her family who considered the event “vulgar” and “beneath them”. 


Instead of disqualifying Sara, Abood featured Sara in a special beatbox solo performance. This campaign is not only about showcasing beatboxers, but also about changing how society views the art and its artists. 

It is Abood’s belief that beatbox and the performing arts in general give people an outlet for self-expression and self-discovery. They also encourage creative and critical thinking. Beatboxing in particular requires discipline and hours of practice which can be done independently or with others.

There are many beatboxers across Jordan, many of whom have never interacted with others in their art form. Beatboxers are largely self-taught, which makes them extremely creative and shows their dedication to the art. The King of the Beat supports and mobilizes the beatboxing community in Jordan, allowing them to gain more exposure to an international beatbox scene while simultaneously changing social views of beatbox and widening young artists’ horizons.

The mission behind the King of the Beat is to empower the beatboxing community in Jordan and provide them with more artistic opportunities on stage in Jordan and gain exposure to the international beatbox scene. We hope in doing so, we can change social views of beatbox and widen young artists’ horizons.


Over the past three years, through his work for the beatbox community, Abood Aladham has:

Provided spaces for young beatboxers to gather, practice and learn new skills, such as in our affiliate Studio 8

Arranged the only Beatbox workshops available in Amman, whose participants go on to compete for the national King of the Beat and Beatbox Unlimited competitions. These competitions are often the first time these young artists have the opportunity to be on stage.

Coordinated with shows and talent competitions for young beatboxers to gain exposure and stage experience

Organized beatbox events to promote the art and give young artists exposure

Promoted the art of Beatbox on TV and radio channels such as Roya and Mazaj.FM

Collaborated with various artists to highlight the versatility of beatbox and encouraged local beatboxers to do the same to bolster their creative process; this includes mixing beatbox with tap dance, guitar, vocals, breakdancing and more! 

Performed at street art events in Amman such as Big Fat Street Jam, Fire Jam, Baladak, and the launch of FADA317 graffiti space.


Why you should back this campaign?

Abood has worked tirelessly and independently to build the beatbox community. The King of the Beat and Beatbox Unlimited national competitions are the results of his work. Now, Abood has bigger plans for the beatbox scene. This year he wants to make the King of the Beat an international event. In light of the lack of support in Jordan for independent artists and especially not for beatboxers, your donations will facilitate: a better competition improving the artistic prospects of its participants, attract international talent, enable us to invite internationally acclaimed beatboxers which will in turn motivate and inspire local artists. We will use the funds raised to invite two high-profile professional beatboxers to Amman to judge the competition (names will be announced closer to the event); provide an attractive reward to the participants; cover all the event’s running costs (including the rental of the space and top quality sound system) and fairly pay all those who are involved in the event (artists, film and event-related staff).

Finally and most importantly, your financial support will enable us to bring about social change by slowly changing society’s attitudes to the beatbox art. 


Break down of costs

Location and sound system: 1000 JD

Prizes: first place 300 JD; second and third 100 JD

Filming, photography, promotional work: 500 JD 

Travel costs for two professional, international beatboxers, including flights, visa costs, taxis, accommodation: 1500 JD

Salaries for judges, performers, security, admin, MC, DJ, door people and management: 1500 JD

Miscellaneous costs: 100 JD

Total:  5,000 JD which is equivalent to approximately 7,000 US Dollars.

On behalf of the King of the Beat team and the Jordanian Beatbox community, we thank you for looking at our campaign and greatly appreciate your support.

story:
Teaser:

FOR SALE HERE:
https://www.oartinternational.com/o-products/
Help us make this pencil a reality! 
We have the prototype and with your help we will make it a reality for everyone.
 

Why this is the best mechanical pencil for artists:

Three in One:
Draw with a range of leads that vary in caliber and hardness: This pencil includes 0.3, 0.5 and 0.7 mm leads, and has an almost magical mechanism based on gravity: Simply face the icon of the caliber lead you desire, push the back button and your lead will come out. The first time I used this mechanism I almost though that the pencil was reading my mind!

 

High Quality: Our mechanical pencil is being made possible by a German company established in 1883 and with a history of producing the highest quality writing instruments. It is being manufactured in Japan with top-notch technology and materials. We did not compromise, the body is made out of brass.

 

Width and Hardness of Leads: For an artist the hardness and the caliber of leads is of prime importance when choosing a mechanical pencil.  With the Tutto3 you have it all in one!
It comes with 0.3 2H, 0.5 HB and 0.7 B leads. Therefore, from light to dark, from thin to thick, you have the full range at your finger tips.
The leads that come in the pencil are artist grade polymer leads, by ArtistLeonardo, ideal for drawing. (They are of standard sizes so they can be interchanged with other brands.)

 

 

 

 

Fully Retractable Sleeve: The metal lead sleeve is fully retractable so as to protect the tip and the sleeve when it is not in use and to protect your shirt or pants when you are carrying it! Push the silver button on the upper side of the pencil to instantly retract the tip of the pencil, either to store it or to select another lead.

 

 

 

 

Anti Slip Knurl: You don’t want your pencil to slip when you are drawing. This classic tight knurl is  the one that most of the best draftsman pencils have used for decades. Except that we extended it further so you can move your hand away from the tip and still be on the anti-slip section.

 

 

 

A Firm Grip: Soft, squishy rubber handles make more difficult the precise control for drawing and draftsmanship. That is why the Tutto3 has a solid grip.

The Clip: The clip allows you to carry the pencil in your breast pocket to take it anywhere with you. It also helps stop the pencil from rolling off the desk.

 

 

 

 

 


Eraser: It has a fine eraser under the cap, made to erase graphite, which is of a standard size so you may easily find replacements.

 

 

 

No need to sharpen it:  Having a thin enough lead, there is no need to sharpen. The pencil does not get shorter and shorter: You can use it all you want and it will always keep its full length (unlike wooden pencils).

A Consistent Line: This is specially important for technical drawing. If you hold the pencil upright, you will get a consistent 0.3, 0.5, or 0.7 line all the time.

Extras: These are the lead sets you get with some perks. They are high quality polymer leads for drawing, by ArtistLeonardo:

 

 

 

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

How the money will be used:

 

  • Producing and distributing the Tutto3 Pencil. We need to produce a minimum of 1,000 units. For this we need $35,000.
  • Continuing our line of new art products, so we can offer you more and more innovations that we hope you will love.
  • Opening Art Galleries around the world (called O Gallery) to support emerging artists.

 

The Impact

How exactly will you be contributing to help art by buying this product? This is how:

  • Part of the funds collected from this campaign will be used to open art galleries called "O Gallery".
  • What exactly is O Gallery: O Gallery is not like a regular art Gallery. These will be all over the world with the first two opening in the year of 2016. O Gallery will represent emerging artists, giving them the oportunity to exhibit locally and internationally. 10 new artists every 6 months, fresh new art every month.

When Will the Tutto3 Be Delivered to You

Once the 35 days of the campaign end, it takes about 2 weeks for the funds to arrive to us to place the order. It will take 90 days to produce them, and then we will ship them in bulk from Japan to the US, from where they will be individually delivered. We estimate you will have it by the end of September. We will try to make it sooner.

      How Can You Help US!

      Just because you are not able to financially help us out, doesn't mean you are not able to help us out at all! Here are some things you could do:

      • Share this campaign with your friends and family (you can use the share buttons that is included in the IndieGoGo page).
      • Tell everyone that you think would be interested in helping spread the beauty of art.

      For the Drawing Perks, choose one of the following original drawings:

       

      1)      2)

      3)      4)

      5)   6)

       

       


      Get one of these beautiful tools and support us making it a reality.

We will try to make it sooner.


How Can You Help US!
Just because you are not able to financially help us out, doesn't mean you are not able to help us out at all! Here are some things you could do:

Share this campaign with your friends and family (you can use the share buttons that is included in the IndieGoGo page).
Tell everyone that you think would be interested in helping spread the beauty of art.

For the Drawing Perks, choose one of the following original drawings: 1)      2)3)      4)

5)   6)
 
 


Get one of these beautiful tools and support us making it a reality.

story:
On June 11th, 2011 “A Gift To The Future, An Evening of Sharing Plant City’s History in 2085,” will feature noted sculptor Robert Woods’ work, “Eternal Time”.  This magnificent, 7’ sculpture depicting eternal time will be unveiled to the public and act as a reminder to future generations of our gift to them.


On January 14, 2010 a time capsule, which contains dozens of items depicting contemporary life in Plant City, was buried in a park on Collins Street adjacent to the "Heart of Plant City" mural. It will stay buried until January 14, 2085. For the next 74 years this wonderful work of art "Eternal time" will mark the spot that holds the memories of our most beloved City of Plant City!


We are taking donations so that we can bring our community together to celebrate the unveiling of Plant City's 1st public sculpture. There will be guest speakers, entertainment, food, and other local artist showing their Art.

story:
WHAT IS SECOND HELPINGS?


Second Helpings is a group visual art exhibition, a “fatinee” of multidisciplinary performance, and a queer intervention into American popular culture’s understanding of the fat body as a deviant body. Exhibiting artists fight the stigmatization of fat bodies, radically re-envision the notion of body diversity, and destabilize deeply embedded hierarchies of desire.


Second Helpings features works in many media by 20+ visual artists, and 8 solo and ensemble performances. Selected works deconstruct and reassess body politics to foster a collective understanding of fatness that empowers and heals fat-bodied people emotionally, sexually and politically.


A new theatrical work humorously addresses the correlation between body shame and cultural imperialism. A 5-piece band named after pastries snacks ritualistically onstage. A debut video work explores racialized and gendered experiences of fat-phobia. A chubby drag queen pushes back on the ways her body is treated as a dystopian object of desire. Come ravenous. Help yourself.

WHAT DOES SECOND HELPINGS NEED? 

Alex Pizzacake & Fallon Young received $1,000 from the Queer Cultural Center to begin to realize Second Helpings. From this modest budget, $800 in commissions were awarded to 13 participating artists to support the production of new work. Scrappiness, appeals for in-kind donations, and other creative solutions ensued, but we still need to pay for installation supplies, venue & technical costs, and financially support the work of the remaining uncommissioned artists, and we can’t do it without your help. 


Here is how our $1,800 fundraising goal breaks down:


  • At $200 we will have covered Alex & Fallon’s out of pocket costs for Second Helpings

  • At $600 we will be able to award $50 commissions to (8) participating artists who have not yet received any assistance to offset the cost of things like printing, framing, costumes and other materials

  • At $1,800 we will be able to double the support individual artists receive to participate in Second Helpings. This is still a modest amount (no artist would receive more than $200) but would be meaningful to these artists who are spending their own time and resources to make this work!

  • Any additional funds we raise beyond $1,800 will be shared among the artists


For total transparency, here is our budget:

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0AmQfgGrFZQcGdDF1X1U4eFFsWnZBZUpIblg5cUFGRlE&usp=sharing


Questions? Email us at secondhelpingsshow [at] gmail.com.


Your support will help us pay our artists. With our small budget, we are paying our artists a fraction of what their meaningful and necessary works deserve. Help us increase those commissions.


WHO IS IN SECOND HELPINGS?



Exhibiting Visual Artists: 

Sookie Bardwell 

Kelsey Beyer 

Adam Carlin 

amy dame 

Jes Espinoza 

April Flores

 Kate Getty 

James Gobel 

Sonia Guinansaca

 Rory Hejtmanek 

Jocelyn Kirkwood 

Julz Hale Mary 

Madsen Minax 

Galadriel Mozee 

Tricia Jameson-Rainwater 

Julio Salgado 

Jukie Sunshine 

Amanda Vigil 

Morgan Weinert 

Rio Yañez

 Fallon Young


Evening Performances by: 

Nic Alea 

Gus Allis 

Celeste Chan, Tania Lee, Tara Shuai (video) 

Maya Chapina 

Jezebel Delilah X

 Fatty Cakes and the Puff Pastries 

Perra Pumps

 Virgie Tovar (MC)


Curated by:  Alex Pizzacupcake & Fallon Young with support from Sarah Guerra & Virgie Tovar


HOW CAN I ATTEND?


Find event details & ticket information here: http://www.somarts.org/secondhelpings


Join the virtual conversation by attending our facebook event:

https://www.facebook.com/events/235222913268774/


Second Helpings was commissioned by the Queer Cultural Center to be part of the National Queer Arts Festival 2014 and is presented at SOMArts through participation in the Affordable Space Program, which provides below-market rental space, production and publicity assistance to nonprofit organizations.

story:
Breve reseña

Mi nombre es Rodolfo Calva (Mr.Mosca) soy Mexicano, desde muy niño empecé a dibujar , ya cuando tuve oportunidad me inscribí a todos los cursos de arte que pude, tomé clases de dibujo , de escultura de cerámica , a los 20 años decidí vender mi carro e irme a Europa, una muy buena persona oyó mi historia y decidió becarme por 3 años, estudié en la Academia de Bellas Artes de Florencia claro trabajando en las noches de barman pues la beca me alcanzaba solo para mis rentas, regresé a Mexico hace 10 años mas o menos con mi esposa y  me he dedicado a producir escultura,pintura , dibujo.  el mes pasado me comunicaron que me han aceptado en la Bienal Internacional de arte de Buenos Aires Argentina, que se llevará a cabo en Noviembre de este año. He pedido apoyo al estado pero me lo negaron por falta de presupuesto.



Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

A cambio de tu apoyo te ofresco litografias, y pequeñas reproducciones de mi obra, claro si apoyas más pues hasta una pieza original !!!

piensa que , por lo general el precio de una pieza se regula por dos factores, 

el primero es la calidad de la pieza y sus materiales, de eso me encargo yo ;)

la segunda se determina por el valor agregado, que es ahí donde nos conviene unir esfuerzos, 

Piensa en este ejemplo, tu cooperas con mi campaña y obtienes una pieza , esa pieza vendrá expuesta en la bienal ( inicia a subir su valor) le sacan una foto y sale en un catalogo ( sube otra vez su valor) la publican en un periódico(más valor), digamos que esa pieza empieza a tener una historia, es así como va subiendo el valor no solo de la pieza sino también del nombre de quien la hizo. es por eso que creo que apoyar a un artista emergente es mejor negocio que comprar obra de artistas que ya están en el mercado. si piensas en términos financieros lo que inviertes y lo que generas es mayor a si compras algo caro que seguro subirá pero solo centavos.

El impacto


La obra que estoy presentado es polémica , siempre he creido que el artista tiene que ser quien registra su tiempo, lo que le tocó vivir, por eso mas que arte siento que es critica social, por supuesto con la máxima calidad y siempre pensando a la excelencia , a superarnos al límite pues el llegar a hacer arte tiene que ver la coincidencia de varios factores como la técnica, el oficio, el concepto y la inspiración, para poder llegar a crear sensaciones y un lenguaje universal.


    Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

    Si no puedes cooperar con dinero lo puedes hacer compartiendo el link de la página, mientras mas personas vean esto , e mas probable que lo logremos

story:
Join the Community

Six years ago I sold my home and shed almost all my worldly possessions to embark on a journey to South America and begin La Comedia, the art project that has become my life’s work. One of the lessons this journey has taught me is that in life, we cannot do it alone...

Because of the individuals and communities who have joined La Comedia along this journey, we have been successful in creating and exhibiting the first two chapters of this project in Buenos Aires and Puerto Rico. Now, at this critical time, we want YOU to join our community too. By contributing to this project you will be able to own original artwork from or prints chosen from our rewards program. Your financial contributions will propel this project to Spain where I will complete the final chapter of this trilogy: Paradise and move towards the culminating exhibition at the Palacio Barolo in Buenos Aires, Argentina.

 

Your Rewards

Click to see our Rewards Video: Esteban Figueroa's Artist Proofs

Exclusive to our IndieGoGo supporters, I am opening up my personal inventory of one of a kind artist proofs and offering them to you at a fraction of their market value. These pieces have been exhibited at various international art festivals, galleries and UNESCO world heritage sites. In addition to these original proofs, we're also offering prints of selected works and limited edition postcards. Other exciting incentives include an opportunity to have your portrait done by the artist himself. Everyone who joins our commnity of supporters will recieve an invitiation to attend our NYC gala event and ALL our supporters will have their names inscribed in gold on the entranceway glass of the Palacio Barolo during the inaugural exhibition. (See the column to the right for all rewards).

 

The Plan of Action

This spring I will travel to Spain to complete Paradise. Over the course of this three-month working period I will hold workshops using Image Theater, a technique whereby participants express ideas and emotions by creating individual or collective human sculptures. Our ten thousand dollar goal will be used for the major activities of the production of this final body of work including travel, materials, equipment, studio space and administrative costs on location in Spain.

 

The Big Idea

A central goal of this project is to use these images to generate cultural education. Through new and existing partnerships with cultural institutions, artists and industry professionals, these paintings will be become the catalyst for events and programing that stimulate dialogue and activity around current social issues and the themes of Dante’s work. This model, developed during the project's first installation in Argentina, has already been successful with communities in Buenos Aires, and after the inaugural exhibition of the complete trilogy in the Palacio Barolo, we are looking to present this project at important venues around the world including Puerto Rico, Russia, China and Australia.

Please visit our website to learn more about La Comedia, the artist, the process and our plans for the year ahead: www.estebanfigueroastudio.com

 

Details

In the event that we do not make our entire goal we will still have the opportunity to make this last chapter a reality. A smaller budget would simply mean scaling down the itinerary in Spain, concentrating most of the activities and workshops in Madrid and Barcelona.

We also understand that not everybody is in a position to give. But remember even small contributions taken together can make a huge difference. You can also be instrumental in this effort by reaching out to your friends, family and networks to spread the word about this campaign. Share our IndieGoGo page link on facebook, twitter and forward it to your contacts.

Thank You

For the last six years I have put my heart and soul, sweat, laughs and tears into this project. It has become the story of my life and I am thrilled to share this journey with you. I want to thank you for visiting my IndieGoGo page and thank you in advance for your collaboration.

Sincerely,

Esteban Figueroa

story:
Help Stefie help!

This fundraiser campaign is set to help me raise the funds required for my placement on a volunteer program with GVN in Guatemala, July 2014. There will be two types of contributions available:

  • Commission Art: By selecting the tier of choice, you can get an original piece of artwork from me of whatever* you ask me to draw! Of course, the artwork characteristics are limited per tier, so read carefully when donating so you can get the best out of your contribution.
  • Selfless Donation: This tier is for those of you who are kind enough to contribute to this cause without wanting anything in return. By selecting this tier, you will contribute USD$10 out of the pure goodness of your heart! Please keep in mind there is no artwork compensation a selfless donation.

*Please keep in mind that I won't be doing any lewd drawings. That means I won't be drawing naked men/women/animals/fantasy creatures in sexual (or suggestive) situations.

I encourage you to visit the GVN website for more information on the volunteering programs they offer. The actual total cost of the fee to keep me working a full month in Guatemala is of USD$2,447, but I'll be attempting to raise just part of the fee due to the number of drawings I'll be limited to complete in two months.


Why does it cost to volunteer?


Paying to volunteer can seem a strange concept. Why should someone charge you to work for free? But this is a common misconception about international volunteer placements —the volunteer work is not what you are paying for. So what is the program package going towards?

Firstly, we want you to know that the Global Volunteer Network is a registered Charitable Trust in New Zealand (Reg # CC46460). This means that we are a non-profit organization and we exist simply to fulfill our mission of connecting volunteers with communities in need with a special focus on vulnerable women and children.

GVN's volunteer programs are based in developing countries within poverty-stricken communities. We partner with local grass-roots organizations who are working hard to make a difference in their community/environment where the majority of people do not have the funds to adequately feed their families, afford health care, or send their children to school. The communities themselves are in need of infrastructure and support and do not have the ability to cover the costs for the much needed assistance a volunteer provides. Our long term aim is for the communities/projects we support to become sustainable and self-sufficient.


The Artwork

Here are some samples of my artwork & what you should expect with each donation tier. All of the drawings are made digitally & will be delivered via email after Nov. 20th, 2013.

Just Inks, $20

Bust, $30

Full Portrait, $40

Group I, $55

Please keep in mind that these drawings are compensations for your donations. This will represent in no way a legal work relationship. The drawings will be made according to demand, so there might be a waiting period to receive your drawing even after Dec. 20th. ONE correction will be made for free if you're not fully satisfied with the drawing.

Thanks again for your interest in helping me out! <3

story:
☠ CABARET DANSE MACABRE ☠

Montréal, QC † 10-11-12 Oct. 2014

Le Cabaret Danse Macabre est un événement international organisé annuellement à Montréal depuis 2010. Festival désormais reconnu dans la scène de la danse Tribale, Fusion et underground depuis 5 ans, il se rémarque par son originalité, sa multidisciplinarité et son invitation à l'immersion dans cet univers «halloweenesque», festif et créatif qui lui est propre.

Cabaret Danse Macabre is an event held annually in Montreal since 2010. Now internationally renowned in the Tribal and Fusion dance scene, the Festival stands out for its originality, its multidisciplinary and its invitation to immersion in this "halloweenesque" festive and creative universe of its own.

* * * * *

MACABRE 2014

mettant en vedette les performances et ateliers de:

featuring performances and workshops by:

Anasma (France) + The Smoky Eyes (France)

* * * * *

Soirée d'ouverture / Opening night

Ven / Friday Oct. 10 @ Théâtre Ste-Catherine

Spectacle principal / Main show

Sam / Saturday Oct. 11 @ Club Soda

Ateliers Macabre / Workshops

10-11-12 Oct.

Détails à venir / Details to come

* * * * *

Forfaits / Perks

Achetez vos billets pour le spectacle principal dès maintenant! Tous nos forfaits incluant les billets viennent avec des T-shirts très tendance (ou camisole). Les frais de livraison sont inclus au Canada et aux États-Unis. Des coûts supplémentaires s'appliquent pour les autres destinations.

Buy your tickets for the main show today! All of our ticket packages come with very fashionable T-shirts (or Tank Tops). Shipping and handling is included within Canada and the United States of America. It will cost extra for all other destinations.

* * * * *

Propulsé par le bénévolat!

L'organisation du Cabaret Danse Macabre est assurée par une équipe bénévole et la participation de la majorité des artistes est bénévole également. Cette campagne de financement a pour objectif de soutenir la production de la 5e édition en 2014. Les revenus de la vente de billets ne suffisent pas à rembourser les dépenses de la salle et la venue des artistes internationaux. De plus, nous devons débourser des milliers de dollars à l'avance pour gérer toute l'organisation et votre soutien nous aidera grandement à y arriver. L'événement grandit en popularité et jusqu'à maintenant, chaque édition a été une réussite. Nous espérons pouvoir continuer sur cette belle lancée et célébrer la 5e édition en grand!

* * * * *

Un concept unique halloweenesque!

Le Cabaret Danse Macabre, c'est une fin de semaine complète d'activités: des ateliers de formation en danse offerts par des artistes de renommée internationale, une soirée d'ouverture mettant en vedette les talents émergents, une soirée festive le samedi 11 octobre au Club Soda et plusieurs autres surprises à être annoncées prochainement. C'est aussi un moment de ressourcement pour la communauté de la danse fusion et tribale d'ici et d'ailleurs. Bref, c'est un événement vraiment unique et un incontournable pour les curieux et les amoureux du côté sombre de la vie!

Missions de l'événement : Création - Formation - Réseautage

Les artistes du Québec et d’ailleurs sont invités à explorer la thématique «halloweenesque» et à créer un numéro inédit ou revisité pour l’événement. Le Cabaret Danse Macabre encourage la créativité et propose un contexte de création spécifique en invitant les artistes à développer un concept original et une trame narrative en lien avec la thématique.

Un des volets majeurs du festival Cabaret Danse Macabre est d’offrir la possibilité aux danseurs de se former auprès d’artistes internationaux invités. Une formation intensive d’une douzaine d’heures est proposée. Les ateliers s’adressent à des danseurs de différents niveaux ayant une base en danse orientale ou tribale et sont également offerts à la carte.

Parallèlement aux spectacles et ateliers de formation, le Cabaret Danse Macabre propose quelques activités de réseautage comme le «Brunch de Bienvenue» et le «Snack d’après Macabre» pour permettre aux artistes venus d’un peu partout de prendre le temps d’échanger dans un contexte plus décontracté que lors des représentations ou des ateliers.

* * * * *

Volunteer-powered!

Cabaret Danse Macabre is organized by a team of volunteers and the majority of artists also participate without income. The aims of this fundraiser is to support the production of the 5th edition, this October 2014. Ticket sales are not enough to pay the expenses of the venue and the international artists. In addition, we must pay thousands of dollars in advance to confirm them. Your support will greatly help us in these important tasks. The event is growing in popularity and so far, each edition was a success. We hope to continue this ongoing momentum and celebrate a great 5th edition!

* * * * *

A unique Halloweenish concept!

Cabaret Danse Macabre is a full weekend of activities: dance training offered through workshops given by internationally acclaimed artists, opening night featuring up and coming talents, festive evening show on Saturday October 11 at Club Soda. It is also a time for getting creative inspiration for the fusion and tribal dance community from here and elsewhere. In other words, this is a truly unique event and a must for the curious and lovers of the dark side of life!

The event’s goals : Creation - Training - Networking

Artists from Quebec and beyond are invited to explore the "halloweenish" theme and create a unique or modified number for the event. The Cabaret Danse Macabre encourages creativity and suggests a context specific creation by inviting artists to develop an original concept and narrative in relation to the Halloween theme.

A major component of the Cabaret Danse Macabre festival is to provide an opportunity for dancers to train with international guest artists . Intensive training of a dozen hours is offered . Workshops are aimed at different levels of dancers that have a basic knowledge of bellydance or tribal, workshops are also offered ‘à la carte'.

Alongside performances and workshops, Cabaret Danse Macabre offers networking activities such as a "Welcome Brunch" and "snack after Macabre" to allow artists coming from allover to take time to share in a more relaxed context compared to performances or workshops.

Fashion

Modded T-Shirt, by Creation SIS
story_txt:
☠ CABARET DANSE MACABRE ☠
Montréal, QC  †  10-11-12 Oct. 2014

Le Cabaret Danse Macabre est un événement international organisé annuellement à Montréal depuis 2010. Festival désormais reconnu dans la scène de la danse Tribale, Fusion et underground depuis 5 ans, il se rémarque par son originalité, sa multidisciplinarité et son invitation à l'immersion dans cet univers «halloweenesque», festif et créatif qui lui est propre.
Cabaret Danse Macabre is an event held annually in Montreal since 2010. Now internationally renowned in the Tribal and Fusion dance scene, the Festival stands out for its originality, its multidisciplinary and its invitation to immersion in this "halloweenesque" festive and creative universe of its own.
* * * * *
MACABRE 2014
mettant en vedette les performances et ateliers de:
featuring performances and workshops by:

Anasma (France)
		+
		The Smoky Eyes (France)

* * * * *
Soirée d'ouverture / Opening night
Ven / Friday Oct. 10 @ Théâtre Ste-Catherine
Spectacle principal / Main show
Sam / Saturday Oct. 11 @ Club Soda
Ateliers Macabre / Workshops
10-11-12 Oct.
Détails à venir / Details to come

* * * * *
Forfaits / Perks
Achetez vos billets pour le spectacle principal dès maintenant! Tous nos forfaits incluant les billets viennent avec des T-shirts très tendance (ou camisole). Les frais de livraison sont inclus au Canada et aux États-Unis. Des coûts supplémentaires s'appliquent pour les autres destinations.
Buy your tickets for the main show today!  All of our ticket packages come with very fashionable T-shirts (or Tank Tops). Shipping and handling is included within Canada and the United States of America. It will cost extra for all other destinations.
* * * * *
Propulsé par le bénévolat!
L'organisation du Cabaret Danse Macabre est assurée par une équipe bénévole et la participation de la majorité des artistes est bénévole également. Cette campagne de financement a pour objectif de soutenir la production de la 5e édition en 2014. Les revenus de la vente de billets ne suffisent pas à rembourser les dépenses de la salle et la venue des artistes internationaux. De plus, nous devons débourser des milliers de dollars à l'avance pour gérer toute l'organisation et votre soutien nous aidera grandement à y arriver. L'événement grandit en popularité et jusqu'à maintenant, chaque édition a été une réussite. Nous espérons pouvoir continuer sur cette belle lancée et célébrer la 5e édition en grand!

story:
Summary

Over the past 10 years I have been working and educating myself in the art, fashion, photography, and music fields. In 2010, I moved to China for one year. During that time, I met Peter, a gallery owner and art enthusiast. He introduced me to an art community that I am still in touch with to this day. 5 + 5 is a show that Peter and I have been curating together for the past 9 months. We are showing 5 Beijing artists and 5 New York artists. The show opens at 5:05PM on November 8th, 2013 at the Under Heaven Contemporary Art Museum in Songzhuang, China. The show will be open for 10 days following. After the show closes, I will be traveling with Peter to Nanjing to discuss and present a plan for an Art Village that is on track to be developed within 3 years. This Art Village will provide studios, galleries, and apartments for artists to take residencies within China.

Funding

With all the creative projects I’ve had the opportunity to be a part of, I have always been self funded or hired. 5 + 5 is the largest financial responsibility I’ve had for a self-funded show. My current job in New York has essentially let me know that in order to prepare for me being gone for a month, they will be phasing me out over the coming weeks. If I am not there, I do not make money. Therefore I am at risk of falling short of my financial goal.

In order to complete my responsibility for the show, I am requesting $3000. This money will be split in two ways:

5 + 5 : Remaining show costs including press materials, surround sound speaker installation, projector screen, etc. that if my work does nothing unordinary will be fine however there is a high risk involved assuming that.

Art Village : Putting together a full presentation, transportation to the meetings, lodging in the town, etc. The meetings that take place during the days following the show will set the stage for the project over the next 3 years.

Conclusion

Any money you contribute to this goes directly to supporting an open channel of art starting with two cities and expanding as we go. My intention is to have art available for everyone. And for me, that starts with this show. 

Thank you for your participation in this project. I appreciate the support you can give. It really means the world to me. 

Alexandra Loulias

www.alexandraloulias.com

story:
Short Summary

My name is Gregory Gray. I am an artist, art director, and graphic designer. I earned a BFA in Graphic Design/Drawing from the Maryland Institute of Art in Baltimore, MD.
My professional background includes editorial design for print publications and art direction for retail advertising. I've worked for Allure, Essence, Elle Germany, Elle Deco, UK, Madame Figaro and Maison Madame Figaro, France. I am currently the Creative Director for Little Gray House Inc. A design company I created in 1998.

My vast experience, international encounters and artistic passion are the DNA of these creations. They are wearable art that promote whimsy and sophistication simultaneously. They represent a new identity, Earthling, transcending ethnicity, religion and sexuality, creating a cultural stew.

Your contribution will cover the costs of my continued exploration enabling me to create more hat sculptures. And I will be able to continue to collaborate with photographers and filmmakers to capture the hats on people and in motion. I will create a site, with your contributions, where the hats are presented to the public.

What We Need & What You Get

I need $7500 and your contributions will be used to:

* Purchase supplies and equipment
* Create videos and photos of the hats in motion and on people
* Build a website to house the hats and show visual collaborations with   photographers and filmmakers

Your generosity and support will be honored with gifts of gratitude:

Gifts from $10 - $25: Set of 12 postcards of the hats
Gifts from $100 and up: 1 tee shirt with hat image
Gifts of $1000: 1 signed and numbered paper hat

The Impact

Your participation will help get my project off the ground; make it possible to share them with folks all over the world; and hopefully exposure that will lead to exhibitions, collaborations and to produce collections of hats for exhibition and the retail market. In a time when so much of what we produce separates us, these hats bring us together around a fundamental human activity: play.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, and you like what I’m doing, spread the word to friends and colleagues, curators, photographers, stylists and whoever you think might enjoy seeing them or collaborating with me.

story:
My Story

Dear Brothers and Sisters, My name is Jonatan Lopez, a Houston based interdisciplinary artist and one of the facilitators of Houston's Performance Art Group "Continuum". I am  honored to be part of "Lone Star Performance Explosion,"  the first International Performance Art Biennale in Houston. Since I am donating my stipend to the artists coming from out of town, I find myself in need to independently raise through this campaign a modest stipend to finance my performance. These funds will be used to  acquire edible chocolate products to be integrated in creative ways during my performance.  


The Impact

My performance piece entitled "Brown," a performance about race and consumerism,  will go down in history as the most frivolous demonstration of freedom in the history of our nation. It will involve public guerrilla  style performances prior to the event and lots of chocolate during the 10 minute stage performance.  


What I Need & What You Get

150 dollars will be enough to get all the chocolate I need for this performance, but if you feel the generous impulse to add more, that would help to give a stipend to the 5 performance artists helping me perform this piece.  Please check out the fabulous perks , appropriately related to the theme of  this performance, that you can acquire in exchange for your generosity.

Please visit  my blog to become acquainted with my performance body of work, which often involves creating  situations that serve as social experiments to open dialogue about  relevant issues in this intricate web we call modern civilization.
http://jonatanlopezart.blogspot.com/ 

For other mediums of art I work in, please visit my website: 
http://jonatan-lopez.com

To become more acquainted with Continuum's performance projects, please visit:
http://continuumperformanceart.blogspot.com/ 


To become for familiar with Lone Star Performance Explosion, (HIPAB) please visit:
 http://lonestarexplosion.org/

(My performance will take place on Friday,  March  the 9th at AvantGarden). 

 Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your brothers and sisters all over the Internets.

I would like to thank in advance the local performance artists that will help me embed this piece into the fabric of art history. 
Sway Younston, Raindawg,  Craig Christie and Keith Brimmer

story:
Summer Arts Camp Webpage

Short Summary

One People is a service and arts organization in Champaign-Urbana, IL dedicated to serving the local and global community through the arts. Our signature event is The Lounge, a free community event that provides a stage for local performers and uses the opportunity to raise support for nonprofits and causes.


In partnership with the Don Moyer Boys and Girls Club, this summer One People will host a one-week Summer Arts Camp. The camp is free and open to all students in the Champaign-Urbana community age 10-14 years; with a particular emphasis in inviting students from low-income and underprivileged families.  The camp’s objectives are for students to:

  • Discover and develop their passion for the arts.

  • Have an opportunity to creatively express themselves.

  • Enjoy free, fun, high-quality programming.

  • Be inspired and encouraged to use their talents to benefit their communities.

  • Grow in confidence that will be exhibited throughout their daily lives.


When registering for the camp, students will pick one of the following concentrations: visual arts, creative writing, vocal performance, or dance. The last day of the camp students will debut their talents at a special The Lounge.  Students in the visual arts concentration will have their work displayed at Figure One Gallery in Downtown Champaign.


What We Need & What You Get

We will need $3,000 to support the camp effectively.  We need to purchase art supplies, sheet music, and various other materials for the different activities the students will participate in.  Since the camp is in the evening, a large amount of the expenses will be from purchasing food for dinner and snacks.  


By donating you will be making a positive impact on students’ lives, an effort that should be rewarded.  If you donate a minimum of $25 or more, you will receive a handwritten custom-designed One People thank you card and t-shirt designed by students in the camp.  If you donate a minimum of $50 or more, you will have preferred seating at The Lounge, on June 27.  If you donate a minimum of $500 or more, your name or organization’s name will be printed in the camp’s brochure, featured on the website, and printed in the program that attendees will receive at The Lounge.


The Impact

We want to provide all students the opportunity to engage with the arts, regardless of their economic status.  Many arts programs in the community are costly, thus limiting access.  We will be working with various other organizations in town to make sure the students in the program are receiving a quality experience, where they are learning and growing.  


One People was founded in April 2013.  Since then we have raised support for a renovation of a primary school in rural Kenya, construction of a free health center in Nigeria, helped spread awareness of women advocacy and resource centers in the Champaign-Urbana area, and raised money and toys for orphaned children in the Democratic Republic of Congo.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate money, you can help us by sharing the campaign with friends, family, coworkers, and random strangers.  Help us get the word out!  If you live in Champaign-Urbana, IL you can also help by volunteering. To learn more, visit www.onepeoplecu.org.
