story:
If you don’t do it, who will?

One of my first collages instructed me to grab fast the magic reins of destiny and hold tight for the ride of a lifetime. I have spent the past four years cutting and pasting together a reality of waking dreams that feel more like home than anything I have ever invested myself in. Anyone that knows me personally can attest to the genuine vigor and zest that accompanies my love of this craft. Scissors, glue, and truth. It’s all I have come to know. What at first it was a mere subtle vibration that has now grown into full blown feelings of fate. I feel it is a responsibility to maintain the highest level of integrity in regards to exploring my work, as it was conceived from tangible material, so it should be experienced. Imperfections in the paper, smudges of glue, humanness at its purest. The digital world is an excellent way of sharing growth and evolution quickly and easily, but the seed seeks root at its origins. It has been a long awaited dream of mine to publish a book of collages, and this is just the first of what I hope to be many future endeavors of attempting to preserve the dying art of old book smell. The cosmos have trumpeted their wishes for the big fish. A greater wisdom emerges from forgotten scraps of paper and I must allow the pieces fall into place.

The portal is open.
 
I am very excited to announce that I will be working with Papercut Press, an independent publisher based out of New York City. We will be printing 50 copies for the initial run, with high hopes for expansion in future. Simplicity is key. A few local bookstores, good hearted galleries, and a few for the grandparents. The rest are for you.
 
Here's the breakdown for the costs:
  • Printing Costs: $441.70
  • Design Costs: $150
  • Total: $591.70

The specs include 7’’x10’’, 52 page full color, magic interdimensional gateways for all your cosmic exploring needs. All your favorite portals, and a few new surprises  to grace your eyes with surreal curiosity and hypnagogic dreamscape. The perfect addition to any bookshelf, tea table, or altar. Makes a great gift for friends, loved ones, and your local community strangers. The new world is upon us, and this is but an opening to the doors of a future greater than any we can imagine. Thank you for believing in the magic, and for making this dream a reality. Because if you don’t do it, who will?

Launch is excitedly set for December 21st 2012 for some electric solstice new world portal action with a bookstore event the afternoon prior. Times and location TBD.

In addition, 10% of all funds raised will go towards local relief efforts for Hurricane Sandy. I am filled with the utmost pride and respect in my city for their actions in response to this tragedy and their beautiful and heartfelt contributions towards our rebuilding process.

story:
*** We apologise that the donations are in dollars.*** 

 

At the time of writing here is a breakdown on the suggested donations in pounds

 

$20 = £12

$40 = £25

$60 = £37

$100 = £62

$250 = £155

 

In the heart of South London a community garden and orchard complete with 85 fruit trees and countless wayward plants sprung into bloom on what had previously been a disused site. Over 100 Volunteers came together over a five-week period to build what became known as The Union Street Urban Orchard. The orchard welcomed visitors during the 3 months it was open and played host to community BBQs, bicycle powered film screenings, live music and creative workshops.

 

There was a tire swing, a ping-pong skip, a fish-pond, a seed library, a LivingARK and a cider-making shed. This space brought people together acting as a place of exchange for members of the local community and visitors to the area.


All the trees and plants that made up the garden have been relocated to new homes on local estates and existing community gardens, adding greenery and increasing biodiversity in this area of London.


In order to keep the story alive and to inspire others to build their own urban garden, the next step for the Union Street Urban Orchard is to publish a book, and for that we need your help!

 

This book will be a manual and a case study - a practical guide to take you through the steps of transforming derelict sites into productive community spaces. It will have step by step drawings of how to create the elements of the orchard, it will have beautiful illustrations and information about all the trees you can grow, it will give recipes of what to cook from your harvest, it will have photo essays on how the orchard was built and most importantly it will be able to tell the story of a project that captured the hearts of all those who experienced this magical place in the summer of 2010.

 

We really hope we can make this publication a reality so that the orchard can live on in the pages of our book.

story:
Background

My name is Kelsey Anderson.  I am an artist from the Twin Cities with a lot of love for New York. Rather than making a one-off donation to the Red Cross to help with Hurricane Sandy relief, my friends and I are donating art as an incentive for others to make financial donations.

As we enjoy the holiday season, let us be grateful for a warm home to sleep in, electricity, running water, and the safety of our family and friends.  Help the Red Cross do what they do best in these disasters.

Art (see Gallery tab for images)

My initial goal is to raise $3000 before Christmas.  100% of every dollar donated will go directly to Red Cross Disaster Relief.  How awesome is Indigogo!

For every donation above $5, you will be able to choose from a range of artwork as your perk for participating.*  Some of these prints are available in very limited quantities and will not be available again. You can do your holiday shopping right here and make a difference in peoples' lives.

Click through the image gallery at the top to see pictures of the art.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't make a financial contribution, you can still help:

  • Donate art or prints which can be used for more perks in this campaign
  • Share this campaign with your networks
  • Visit www.redcross.com/waystohelp
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you and happy holidays!

Kelsey

*Shipping of perks is only available in the U.S.  Please contact me if you would like to receive a perk outside of the U.S.

story:
KEEP LOCAL ART ALIVE - CREATE A NEW HOME FOR THE VINTAGE

The Vintage (in operation since January 2009) has served as one of the few remaining all ages venues in the greater Scranton area. The mission of The Vintage is to cultivate and exhibit original works of nearly every style/genre in the literary, performing and visual arts.

We believe that the arts are necessary for any city to not only survive, but thrive! With a focus on local artists/performers we have produced countless concerts, visual exhibits/installations, performance pieces, film screenings and much more (and all in under four years)! With all ages programming we maintain a firm resolve to remain accessible and approach for all artists and patrons! We strive to help as many artistic visions come to life - no matter the medium or the style - art is for everyone, everyone can be apart of art!

We have hosted such artists and events as The Menzingers, Ted Leo, The Spinto Band, John Bromberg, Tigers Jaw, Constance Denchy, Scranton Storyslam, The Shelby Company, Pecha Kucha Scranton, Tigers Jaw, A Fire With Friends, A Social State, Appache Chief, The Mad Conductor and many more!

Due to forces beyond our control we had to leave our home rather quickly. While we are proud of our work these past few years we feel there is still much to be done. We hope that the incredible art we have hosted has made some sort of impact on the community at large.

We are in need of a new home, which is why we need you now more than ever! We will be staying in downtown Scranton, not only to stay centrally located but to support the amazing businesses and projects that are currently working to revive the community!

Your generous donations will be put to good work. The funds will be going towards -

  • Securing a new home
  • New sound equipment
  • Paint / Paint Supplies
  • Office Supplies
  • Furniture
  • and more costs incurred by the move!

Not only will you you ensure The Vintage can keep doing its great work - BUT we also have some awesome 'perks" which can be yours!

No amount is to small and of course no amount is to large! We thank you all for your support and hope it will continue! Please be apart of this new chapter in The Vintage history! You make this all possible, YOU create the community you want to be apart of!

KEEP LOCAL ART ALIVE!

story:
Ahoy matey! Welcome to the home port of the Dubstar, the East Coast Art-Car making bi-coastal waves.

The TL:DR is that the Space Pirates have created a new immersive type of Burning Man camp and community, but getting their vessel to Playa Home and home again is costing the captains left eye, the 1st mates right foot, the cabin boy's pet parrot, and $5000 more gold than the crew currently has. YOUR DONATION MAKES A HUGE DIFFERENCE, HELP US GET HER TO PLAYA AND BACK!!

Please support this art-bus-community-machine with a generous donation of $40 or more. Grateful pirates will repay you with anything from shouting your name at the first Pirate Toast on Playa, to T-shirts, eyepatches, or even a full night of Pirate Style Sailing on Dubstar herself! 

 

DUBSTAR is one of the rare East Coast art cars- built by the Space Pirates and loved by everyone on our side of the island. Used locally for public recreation centers, summer camps, art events and community outings, her first trip to playa in 2011 was a huge success. Disguised as a shark, this space ship cruised the dust and shared her decks with more than 2,000 BRC Citizens over the week.

 

The Space Pirates are best known for our weekly, radically-inclusive art parties in Philadelphia. We invite everyone out who is intersted in making or participating in art, and regularly blow their minds with the size and scale of art we are able to produce as a team. We would LOVE to see you out there, bring whatever art you are working on or come willing to help someone else with theirs!

 

 

Dubstar is is not just the Space Pirate art car- she's also the entire camp.

We take radical participation and inclusion to a whole new level, by keeping our interactive art project in constant play with the public and refusing the lure of a comfortable, private camp. We stay in full shwashbuckling character for the whole week, sleeping, eating, and sharing our ship on a constant cruise around the playa. Dubstar is NOT a private party ship, and we never close our decks! This year, Dubstar is equipped with $5000 in mechanical upgrades, a dance floor, hanging bike racks and dance cage, extreme amounts of lighting and sound, an AI, intercoms, hammocks, day shade, wind turbine, a grill, a full-sized interactive ships helm, innertubes for playa tubing, and this year-- a BRAND-NEW SANDWORM SKIN!! YARR!! Imagine yourself standing at the helm of the Great Sandworm Dubstar, with your pirate-shwag in hand, steering the course of your ship with the sun on your goggles and dust in your hair. Or playa-tubing in style, pulled by the great mothership.

 

You love art, and art-cars, and of course you like supporting it. But whats unique about Dubstar, of all the art out there asking for help? Dubstar is Philadelphia's #1 interactive tool that brings the playa home and shares it with the local community.

Summer camps, city rec centers, and many private local parties all use this artcar regularly. We are constantly sharing the 10 principles of Burning Man- especially gifting, radical participation and radical inclusion- with anyone who climbs aboard. Your gift supports not just one camp's art on the playa, but the community of Philadelphia, New York, Washington D.C., and more-- by giving kids and adults the experience of the "Dreams Bus."


We are asking you today to support this community art cars return to the Playa with your generous donation of $40. Think of it as half a tank of gas, 8 cans of spraypaint, or a bottle of good rum. With these gifts, we share her interactive art with thousands of grateful participants, on and off the playa. Take a moment to support Dubstar and the Space Pirate commitment to community with your generous donation. Every dollar and dubloon helps, and we all ARRRRRRPRECIATE YOUR HELP!!

 

 

PERKS:

The stickers are great! These are the die-cut, full color outdoor ones- modeled by a pirate (and still on the backing. Maybe you'll get this one, if you ask nicely)! We also have fluorescent-neon-orange on black, and black/white Dubstar logo stickers.

 

     

Please keep in mind, T-shirts run large; if you normally rock a medium you may want a small instead. Please indicate your size in the comments section of your pledge, and include $5 shipping if you do not want on-playa pickup.

 

           

Eyepatches vary in size, please indicate in the comments section if you want yours to be larger or smaller, as well as whatever decorations you are partial to- hard drives, gears, spikes, chains, etc. Add $5 shipping if you do not want on-playa pickup.

 

For a view of the spinning eyepatch prototype VIDEO, please go to http://s310.photobucket.com/albums/kk438/zeutstarz/

story:
Arrrrr! Here There Be Pirates

North Coast Repertory Theatre is entering our thirtieth season of providing quality non-profit theatre to California's North Coast. Our expenses can not be paid by box office alone, so we're turning to piracy!

July 6th at the Wharfinger building in Eureka, we will be throwing a pirate ball. Come in your best pirate costume and dance the night away to the music of Swing Set featuring Donna Landry.  Enjoy belly dancing with Ya Habibi Dance Company. Watch sword fights, get your fortune told, get a pirate tattoo and help fund Eureka's longest running live theatre company.

Why Should You Help These Scallywags? What Do You Get?

Yarrr! Expenses get in the way of treasure! Space rental, band fees, food expenses, help us outfit our crew so that we can get this fun event out on the high seas. Help us launch our ship and you will get a combination of the following:

  • Tickets to the event. Get your pirate on! Yarrrr!
  • Pirates need notoriety. Get shout outs on Facebook and the NCRT website so you can build your pirate legend!
  • Get a certificate announcing to the world that you are a pirate captain and a member of the NCRT fleet.
  • Get a personalized custom story about a legendary piratical adventure that you and your crew experienced.
  • Have a pirate poem in your honor on the night of the event.
  • Free pirate tattoos on the night of the event!
  • Feed your crew! Get a ticket for free pizza or strawberry shortcake.

Where's the Treasure?

Last year's pirate ball was popular and we'd like to make this into an annual event.  Help make this into one of NCRT's most successful annual fundraisers!

Can't Donate Booty? Join the Publicity Crew

Can't afford to donate but you still want to help the good ship NCRT?  Share share share the word!  The more this treasure map gets out on Facebook and social media, the more likely we are to fill our coffers!.

story:
My name is Nate "Ishe" Lappegaard and I am a musician, artist, and member of the Colorado Burning Man Community.  I am building a piece of art entitled Alchemical Elevation, which will float four 6' glowing spheres of light 100' above the heads of participants at this year's Apogaea festival.  Art at both Apogaea and Burning Man has inspired me year after year, and I feel an obligation to continue the tradition of wonder and inspiration that encapsulates the spirit of our community.

We need to raise an additional $1500 to bring this project to reality, in addition to the $1200 art grant I recieved from Apogaea and the $500 of my own money I will be investing into the project.   The funds will be used to purchase the tools, materials, and transport needed to successfully complete this project.

Contributors of $50 or more will recieve a personally signed, hand duplicated copy of the Ishe and Dirt Monkey album, "Turn Up the Ride."   

Contributors of $150 or more will recieve the aforementioned album as well as a hand-crafted item of custom clothing created by Rue.

Contributors of $750 or more will recieve a gourmet meal prepared by Rue and Ishe at this year's Apogaea festival (or your home if you cannot go), two additional custom items of clothing by Rue, and a private dj performance by Ishe, in addition to the aforementioned items.

If we do not reach our goal, all funds will still be applied to the completion of a scaled-down project.

Art is important. It opens minds and inspires others to create.

Please contribute what you can.   If you cannot make a donation, please spread the word about this project to those who can.  Feel free to contact me at djishe@gmail.com if you have questions or ideas about the project.   

Thanks!

Art is important. It opens minds and inspires others to create.
Please contribute what you can.   If you cannot make a donation, please spread the word about this project to those who can.  Feel free to contact me at djishe@gmail.com if you have questions or ideas about the project.   
Thanks!

story:
Short Summary


Hi everyone.  Thanks for visiting.  My name is Kara Dunne, and I'm a printmaker living in Providence, RI.  I am launching this campaign to fund the printing of my book, 

'The Alternative Hustle: the Dance Steps Between the Dance Moves.'  I have been inspired by the decade of the 70s and disco as a dance movement for quite some time; I have been interested in using dance steps from instructional manuals to illustrate what can happen in between the prescribed dance steps during the dance.   I have decided to make my current disco hustle print series into a larger series in the form of a book.  I am an artist and teacher, and my current salary provides me just enough for living expenses and some art supplies, but not enough for the printing and distribution of this book.  

'The Alternative Hustle' is an artist book that maps out the dance steps of the hustle beyond instructional purposes.  Each page maps out a different scenario of what else could happen on the dance floor during the hustle.  Screen printing will be the primary printing process.  I would not be able to afford the paper and ink for a large scale edition of this book, and it is my hope that I meet the funding goal for this project so that I can distribute this original artwork on a larger scale.  

Funders who give 200 will receive a signed copy of the hand printed book, which will have 25 pages, each page an original multi-layered screen print of a different hustle variation.  The book is 11" x 15" in size. 

Funders who give 100 will receive five signed hustle prints from the book

Funders who give 45 will receive two signed hustle prints from the book

Funders who give 25 will receive one signed hustle print from the book

Funders who give 10 will receive a digital print of one of the pages (8.5" x 11" in size)

Funders who give 5  will receive two postcards of pages from the book.

story:
Help us celebrate 10 years in the arts!

Art on the Lawn, the Giles Arts Council’s annual juried fine arts show, is turning 10 years old!  Located on the lawn of the beautiful, historic Giles County Courthouse in Pearisburg, VA.,  Art on the Lawn has been honored by Virginia Living Magazine as one of the top 3 arts events in Southwestern Virginia in 2012, 2013, 2014 and 2015.  Artists from throughout Southwestern VA, southern WV, Northern VA, and several areas of North Carolina come together to take part in this intimate, one day show.  Visitors travel from many of the same areas to see and purchase the wonderful art offered here.  Children and their parents enjoy our hands on children’s are venue, Kids Art Adventure, where they get to experience various mediums of art with teachers from the area.

With help, we can make a great show even better!

Art on the Lawn is a small event with a small budget.  As our artists and visitors have grown to include many different areas so has our need to advertise beyond our Giles County limits to other areas in the New River Valley, Roanoke Valley and into West Virginia.  This campaign will enable us to increase our advertising capabilities into these areas in order to attract more wonderful artists and visitors who will be a benefit to the tourism economy of Giles County.  Part of the money raised through this campaign will be used to expand Kids Art Adventure to include art experiences for the tween/teen population who are not included at the current time.

By contributing to this campaign you will be helping Art on the Lawn continue our goal of providing an outlet for artists to show and sell their art. Giles Arts Council is a 501c3 organization dedicated to the encouragement, nurturing and promotion of the arts in Giles County, VA.  Your contribution to our campaign will help us provide an enjoyable art experience for the children of Giles County.  Right now art is not available to the children in our schools until they reach high school and can take art as an elective course.  Children need art from the time they can hold a crayon, through elementary and middle school and beyond. 

How you can help......

We would like to raise at least $3,000 dollars to expand our advertising from our local newspaper to newspapers in the nearest metropolitan areas, i.e. Roanoke, VA and Bluefield, WV.  We would like to be able to place ads in the New River Valley Magazine and The Roanoker Magazine as well.  If we exceeded our goal, we could even consider TV ads on local networks! We also are planning to expand our Kids Art Adventure to appeal to the tweens/teens age group. More substantial materials and media will need to be purchased.

We feels that our goals can be met, but if they are not, the funds we DO raise will go into increased advertising and into our Kids Art Adventure as far as they can be stretched. 

Impacting Future Artists!

It has been proven that those who engage in the art are more well-rounded, and contribute more to their communities. Children who receive art education function better in school are more disciplined, better at problem solving and relating to others.  Kids Art Adventure is an effort to bring art education through hands on experiences to children who otherwise would not be getting art education.  Your contribution will help this effort grow and reach more children, tweens and teens.  These same children will someday be going out into other areas of Virginia and into other states to be the leaders of those communities.  This art education can ensure that we these children will be better prepared for their futures and leading our states and our country in years to come. 

Your contribution is essential to our being able to increase advertising into areas outside our region so that more people will attend Art on the Lawn, purchase more art from our fine artists and bring more tourism dollars into Giles County and the surrounding communities.  It's all about county sustainability!  As people travel on their way to Giles County they may pass through your community, stop for gasoline, to eat, to spend a night – bringing tourism dollars to your community as well.



We've Come a Long Way, Baby....

It all started 11 years ago with a small community art show which took place on the parking lot of the local bank. The following year, during the Giles County Bi-Centennial Celebration, and with bank sponsorship, the show moved up the street to the lawn of the Giles County Courthouse and Art on the Lawn as we know it today was BORN!


Each year the artists who apply and come to present their artwork at Art on the Lawn has increased, as has the quality of artwork.  Four years ago we added the Kids Art Adventure, and the popularity of Art on the Lawn increased again.  Part of our success can be attributed to our volunteer teams.  From the time the artists begin to arrive on site at 7 a.m., volunteers assist them in moving their display supplies and artwork to their assigned sites.  They assist in set up as well - something unique to art shows.  During the day volunteers are there to meet the artists’ every need.  Then at the end of the day they are there to assist in tear down and getting things back to the artists’ vehicles.  Artists feel appreciated and appreciative.  All our surveys have commented extensively about our wonderful volunteers and the friendly, supportive people of Giles County. 

The Arts Scene Takes Note....

In 2012, 2013, 2014 and 2015 Virginia Living Magazine has named our small show one of their Top 3 Art Events in southwestern Virginia.  We do not take this lightly as we realize that the other 2 top winners are very large shows and have been around since 1948 and 1958 respectively.  This 10th anniversary show is expected to be our largest and best to date!



Our Benefactor - The Giles Arts Council....


The Giles Arts Council is a small group of individuals dedicated to encouraging, nurturing and promoting the arts in and around the county.  Whether it be by supporting our Little Theater group, Art on the Lawn, Art at the Library for preschool children, TACK (Theater Arts Camp for Kids), Kids Art Adventure, awarding two art scholarships each year, sponsoring concerts, commissioning mural and sculptures through our Art in Public places partnership with the Town of Pearisburg, etc., the members of Giles Arts Council work tirelessly to achieve our goals.  We have been fortunate to have wonderful support for Art on the Lawn from both the Town of Pearisburg and Giles County.  In fact, the Town Manager and several other Town and County officials are among the first to sign up as volunteers each year and are there at 6:30 a.m. to get started!


Challenges Ahead....

Sustainability in a rural county is tough - sustaining of the arts is even tougher!

Art on the Lawn’s biggest challenge is funding.  Last year, due to the impending shut down of Appalachian Power Company’s local power plant, we lost an annual $1000 sponsorship.  The local bank with whom we started this event merged with another bank who no longer wishes to to contribute as a sponsor.  A double-edged sword, if you will, also arose when the County Tourism Office hired its new Director of Tourism, and funds originally earmarked for its sponsorship program were redirected - a loss of $1000 for our budget.  This is a small community with no large businesses to make up the lost sponsorship money.  Money that would have been used for advertising and supporting Kids Art Adventure. We have to find other means to support this wonderful event. Other funding is used for other advertising such as roadside banners, poster printing, call to artist post card, postage; awards (both cash and ribbons); day-long entertainment; office supplies; water, soft drinks and snacks provided for artists, their assistants, and our volunteers for the day. In other words, all the overhead expenses that go along with running an event like Art on the Lawn. 

The Art on the Lawn organizing committee is made up of very intelligent, creative, open minded and flexible people who are intent on making Art on the Lawn the very best show it can be with the resources we have with which to work.

To date, Giles Arts Council has applied for a grant from the Community Foundation for the New River Valley in hopes of gaining extra funds to help with the overhead of Art on the Lawn.  Local industries and businesses have been approached for sponsorship dollars as well.  Local individuals passionate about the arts and their community have been generous with their financial support of Art on the Lawn as well.  We will continue to search for other outlets of support. Each member of the Art on the Lawn organizing committee has a specific role to play in seeking ways to support their part of the event.  One member, who has a banking background and the contacts that go with that, is approaching larger corporations outside Giles County for support at budget-making time.  That would include hospital corporations, banks, finance companies, manufacturers to name a few.  Indiegogo is another way we feel we can reach out to like-minded individuals for support in promotion of the arts through Art on the Lawn.

story:
Campaign in English below!!

La colectiva Afro Lesbiana Otim va al "Festival queer/trans e inter, negras y personas de color" el  25 a 27 de julio 2015, en Berlín, para ofrecer tres talleres. El primer taller es para reunir y compartir historias de nuestras ancestras. Como por ejemplo la de Otim, Orixà transexual o el romance de Yansã y Oxum. El segundo es sobre metodologías feministas de resolución de conflictos en contextos interraciales y/o lgbtqueer. El tercero será un taller abierto de capoeira angola LesboTransFeminista.

En el primer taller queremos trabajar sobre los mitos de lxs orixas, voduns, inquices y encantadas que se consideran "desviadas"; dar un pequeño repaso en nuestra ancestralidad. Vamos a grabar esas historias contadas por las personas. 

En el segundo taller vamos a sentir/pensar cómo usar las críticas para fortalecer nuestras comunidades, sin destruirlas. ¿Como hacer/recibir criticas con más cuidado? ¿De que otras formas tenemos que resolvernos, además de silenciandonos, denunciando los cotilleos venenosos, rupturas drásticas y grupitos? Vamos intercambiar ideas y estrategias de autocuidado.

El tercer taller pretende hacer una vivencia y práctica de auto defensa, danza, juegos y canciones de la ancestralidad negra con instrumientos musicales afrobasileños. Afirmando una conexión entre lésbicas, trans e inter, negrxs y racializadxs, con el objetivo de desconstruir las relaciones de poder y jerarquias, construyendo empoderamientos sapatão(camionera), feminista y transfeminista.


Lo que necesitamos 

Necesitamos dinero para logra llegrar a Berlín al encuentro-festival.

Cada pasaje de ida y vuelta sale R$ 4.000 (REAIS brasileiro) o € 1.200 (USD Dollar) o $1.345 (Euros).

Además de esta campaña contamos con amigos que esperan poder recaudar fondos a través de fiestas.


El impacto

Nuestro proyeto es importante para nosotras y para lxs lgbtqueer negrxs en la diaspora, para intercambiarmos saberes ancestrales y fortalecernos dentro y fuera de nuestras comunidades.

El taller de capoeira feminista en el Encuentro Lesbico Feminista Latinoamericano y Caribeño, puedo darnos confianza y fuerza para hacer lo que pretendemos alla, en Berlin.

Lo que hacemos como colectiva día a día rescata nuestras historias y ancestralidades que se han intentado borrar de diversas formas en la historia, desde las mas crueles y evidentes a la invisibilización silenciosa. Rescatamos el trabajo y la esperitualidad desde una perspectiva negra, lésbica, trans y feminista, como manera de rescate y de roptura de opresión, usando el arte como herramienta expresiva. Eso es lo que queremos compartir, no sólo en el Festival, pero es ahí donde tendremos la oportunidad de encontrarnos con otrxs que repliquen estos conocimientos en sus propias comunidades, a la vez que aprenderemos de lxs otrxs sus experiencias ancestrales.


Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Sabemos que no todxs pueden ayudar donando dinero, pero eso no significa que no puedan colaborar. Ayúdanos difundiendo la campaña en tu mural y en los murales de tus amistades, en listas de e-mail, Ongs, en los grupos feministas autónomos y antiracistas.

Y deseándonos Axè y buena vibra para que todo salga bien!


Link to our campaign in English:

http://giradeotim.tumblr.com/post/116398334065/were-going-to-berlin-to-join-the-queer-trans

story:
A creation of a portfolio of beaded 3D wall mask. A representation of the people that travel though our lives, affecting our creation.

I am trying to raise funds for the Mystical Travelers to have an exhibition.

I need 20 pieces.  I have 3 fully complete and 6 mask ready to be mounted and hooded. 

The wholesaler I was using is no longer available.  The beads now cost me 4 times what they once did.  This is a big part of the reason I am seeking help in accomplishing this project.

The technique used to create these mask are unique, making them a new concept.

Here is a almost finished project : 

-----------------------------------------------------------
The Impact

Doing something new is risky. I have taken the complete Mystic Travelers to galleries to wage if my endeavors will be fulfilling. The outcome was strong encouragement to complete a portfolio for an exhibit to be possible. This means a lot to me & could be a turning point in my career

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word to friends and family

story:
What's going on?

My name is Lenee (Lee-Nay) Freeman. I'm a freelance visual journalist and collage artist originally from Baltimore, MD. I have a background and passion in photography and collage making.

I've had a camera in hand since the age of 9 and I've been making collages out of my images since I was about 12 years old. At this time in my life I've been combining the two to crate inspirational art, to create positivity, to change ideas of beauty, and promote self love.



This campaign is to expand my mission of continuing a movement that changes one's environment, behavior, and beliefs with your help. My goal is to produce a new art collection to put on display and sell.

Get involved to supporting an entrepreneur, an local artist, to feel good about making a different in someone's life. (You can contribute any amount besides what's listed.)

Where will the funds will go?

30+ new prints in various from small prints to large poster sizes
  • I've listen to you say you want bigger artwork to fill your home, your office, or to give as a gift. I want to bring you bigger artwork without you having to wait for it.
  • I am having this collection be a high quality product, on beautiful archival paper, mounted a sturdy backing that's ready to be framed and packaged to sell to fill those blank walls and to create a positive environment.
Submission to exhibitions
  •  I plan on taking larger pieces of artwork to put on display in art markets, art fairs, and exhibitions. A portion of the money raised will go to the cost to submit to shows in MD, VA, DC, PA and BEYOND to get more people to become inspired, change their ideas of beauty,
Limited edition press printed cards
  • Majority of my greeting cards are handmade and may only be one in stock but you may be in need of two, three, or four of those cards. I want to be able to provide you with professional quality printed cards, reproductions of the original handmade collage, but in a small quantity.
Online buying option
  • I will have my collection professional photographed and place online to be accessible to the online shopper and art supporter in any location.
Funds over the goal
  • Any donations that exceed my goal will go towards charity.

The impact

You are supporting the art community and being a known giver. Together we are:

  1. Inspiring
  2. Motivating
  3. Changing behavior
  4. Expanding an audience
  5. Creating positive environments
  6. Promoting self love.
...all through art, through how I see art and life.

Other ways you can help

You can donate anything amount besides the amounts listed and it will be much appreciated. You can also spread the word about the fundraiser to other art lovers.
story_txt:
What's going on?
My name is Lenee (Lee-Nay) Freeman. I'm a freelance visual journalist and collage artist originally from Baltimore, MD. I have a background and passion in photography and collage making. I've had a camera in hand since the age of 9 and I've been making collages out of my images since I was about 12 years old. At this time in my life I've been combining the two to crate inspirational art, to create positivity, to change ideas of beauty, and promote self love.This campaign is to expand my mission of continuing a movement that changes one's environment, behavior, and beliefs with your help. My goal is to produce a new art collection to put on display and sell. Get involved to supporting an entrepreneur, an local artist, to feel good about making a different in someone's life. story:
Short Summary

Help us make the 2015 calendar  better than the 2014. We are stepping up our game in every way from the design, the guns, and most importantly...the girls!

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise enough money to pay for the models travel expenses, wardrobes, and props. A small amount will also be used to cover the design portion of the calendar. 

  • 75% of the donations will go to cover the cost of the shoot.
  • 20% will go towards the designing phase.
  • 5% will go towards the goods that will be sent out as a thank you.

The Impact

All proceeds from the calendar will go directly into the following years calendar. Every year our goal is to bringing you a better calendar.

Risks & Challenges

If we do not raise our complete goal the remainder of the funds needed will come from raising the calendar prices and/or gear on the website. 

  • We strive to keep our prices low and offer the best and fastest customer service available.
  • By pledging your donation you can assure that people can still get quality gear at affordable prices.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share our campaign on social media platforms
  • Purchase items from our web store. 
  • Donate items to be used in the calendar.

story:
Who are we?

We are the Seed Group: an ensemble of NYC-based individuals from various professional, artistic, and cultural backgrounds. We were brought together in a project of the Open Program of the Workcenter of Jerzy Grotowski and Thomas Richards. Most of us met and worked with the Open Program for the first time earlier this year, while some of us have already had a long-standing relationship with the Workcenter. Their work moved us and made us move, shaping our collaboration toward a long-term project in the USA: the NYC Revival Dream.

What is the Open Program?

The Open Program is one of two teams currently active at the Workcenter (Pontedera, Italy): a center for research into the actor’s craft that is of truly world-wide significance. The living legacy of the Workcenter's world-renown founder, a major figure in 20th century theatre theory and practice, Jerzy Grotowski, is research in the area of Art as vehicle: the actor's work on him/herself. The Open Program's current work seeks to bridge this ongoing research to wider social realities—meeting, interacting and working with local communities through different kinds of performative works and practices. Seeking to discover the nucleus of theatre and performance, the moment of a meaningful contact between human beings on a common ground beyond cultural and other perceived differences, the Open Program is asking: what can the elements of culture in the sharedwork of our artistic craft be a vehicle for in the context of a community and between communities? What are its intrinsic and social potentialities? How can a theatre piece, a concert, a feast, a holiday, provide a common ground for contact and transformation of perception?

Since its inception, 29 years ago, the Workcenter's praxis and research has been articulated from the practical basis of a research on ancient songs of the African and Afro-Caribbean diaspora. For 7 of those years, the Open Program, a team of international performers directed by Mario Biagini, has been tracing a new branch of this research: an in-depth exploration of old African-American songs of the U.S. South and of different forms of artistic creation and event, as vehicles for contact and meeting. This is a search for artistic competences and uniquely articulated capacities of meaningful interaction within and between communities, based on the recognition of unique individual as well as shared cultural resources.

What are we doing?

In the winter of 2014, the Open Program launched a completely self-produced two-month program of performances, workshops, and meetings in NYC, reaching out to various individuals and communities throughout the city. They initiated weekly Open Choir sessions at West Park Presbyterian Church: meetings open to all, where people could explore the work on songs by direct participation. The Seed Group emerged out of this larger fluid group, unified by the desire to continue exploring these songs and to sustain the work of the Open Choir. Since the formation of the group, with the continued long-distance mentorship of the Open Program, the Seed Group has been meeting weekly at West Park Presbyterian, as well as in smaller groups, to pursue the work of rehearsing and researching together.

What are we raising funds for?

Continuing to work in collaboration with the Open Program to develop our practice and to reinstate and sustain the weekly Open Choirs, our wish is to create a space for the possibility of a meeting based on artistic and human values beyond all perceived boundaries or dislocations.

We have initiated this campaign to raise funds to bring the director of the Open Program, Mario Biagini, along with three members of the team, back to NYC for four weeks in June and July 2014. With their guidance we will continue to refine our work, thus creating the basis for a sustainable and mutually nurturing practice among ourselves and alongside local communities. During this visit of the Open Program, we will also begin to explore and implement various Seed Group proposals toward the long-term project. This month-long work together will culminate in a two-day Symposium, hosted at West Park Presbyterian, featuring both practical and discursive explorations of the function of song in artistic and community practices.

The funds raised through this campaign will go toward the flights and accommodation of the four Open Program members for the duration of this work in NYC. In addition to monetary contributions, we are also gratefully accepting in-kind donations for the accommodations of these four international artists in NYC.

What’s in it for you?

Ever since our initial encounter with them, we have found that the work done by the Open Program with these songs has the potential to reveal creative forces and capacities, and to develop competencies that can help us to interact in new ways with our surroundings, touching upon the richness and depth of humanity that lies within each of us. This work can transform, nourish, and empower ourselves and others.

By contributing to this campaign, you are helping our effort to keep this creative power alive, by perfecting our artistic craft as a tool for human communion. Our incentives (listed below) are merely a small way of signaling our gratitude, and range from public thank you’s on social media outlets, to a private performance of the Open Program for you and your friends. We hope that, whatever you can contribute monetarily to this project, you will come to witness this work first-hand as it continues to grow and develop over the coming months in NYC. In the end, your most important contribution is your acceptance of our invitation to participate in this process directly. We will be most happy to see you at the next Open Choir, at our Symposium, or to meet you soon wherever in the world you may be!

story:
Breve reseña

Ayer un incidente puso patas arriba nuestra vida: se rompió el pestillo de la puerta del despacho y nuestra privacidad nos fue arrebatada. El resultado es que para poder abandonar el despacho tuvimos que forzar la puerta, quedando como se puede ver en las imágenes.

Este proyecto trata de recuperar la privacidad de un espacio. De restituir una puerta que simboliza el resguardo que toda persona desea tener. Las puertas nos protegen, las puertas nos otorgan privacidad, las puertas nos otorgan seguridad. Vivimos en un mundo donde la privacidad, la seguridad y la protección del individuo cada día son amenazadas.

Este es un proyecto para recordar a todos la importancia de estos valores a través de la sustitución de una puerta rota. Cambiemos esta puerta para empezar a cambiar el mundo.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

  • La financiación irá íntegramente destinada a la adquisición y montaje de una nueva puerta en el despacho por manos de un experto de reconocido prestigio en el ámbito del montaje y sustitución de puertas en viviendas y otros espacios, el popular artista de la madera "inhabitants". El coste del proyecto incluye su desplazamiento y manutención.
  • Las recompensas serán amplias y variadas para todos los colaboradores.
  • En caso de no lograr el objetivo los fondos serán destinados a sustituir la puerta poniendo dinero de nuestro bolsillo.

El impacto

  • Esta campaña es un proyecto único e innovador en el mundo. Nadie hasta la fecha ha tratado de esta forma la importancia de la privacidad en la vida de las personas.
  • El personal que participa en la ejecución de este proyecto cuenta con amplia y dilatada experiencia, con más de 10 años de experiencia individual y más de 50 años de experiencia conjunta.
  • Este proyecto no es un bluff, puedes ver el estado en el que ha quedado la puerta y podrás ver cómo queda una vez se coloque una puerta nueva.

Riesgos y desafíos

El principal desafío de este proyecto es encontrar la financiación adecuada que permita la correcta adquisición y montaje de una nueva puerta. Contamos con la colaboración de personal experto en el proyecto (http://www.meneame.net/user/habitante) que garantiza al 100% el cumplimiento del proyecto en caso de éxito de la financiación.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

En caso de que no puedas colaborar económicamente, siempre puedes difundir esta campaña.

Gracias y recuerda: primero cambiaremos esta puerta, luego cambiaremos el mundo.

story:
Short Summary

Hi I am Noelle Huerta a freshman student at Green Fields Country Day School that is fundraising for an amazing experience to attend the  Sonoran Glass Academy. This is a great experience for me to learn and advance in my artistic abilities. This Experience is provided by Green Fields Country Day School and will take place on March 23-27 from 9:00 am - 2:00 pm each day. Any and all contributions big or small will be greatly appreciated and will be one step closer to my goal. 

What We Need & What You Get

100% of funds raised goes to the program cost.  

The Impact

All donations big or small will be helpful and appreciated. This experience will help me improve, and learn new techniques that will help expand my abilities in the art field.  All contributors will receive a gift determined by the amount of the donation. For example a  $15 donation can get you handmade crane earnings with a large variety of colors and sizes. As well as a small painting/sketch with the option of giving you the choice of design or theme, this will include a variety of size selections.  Keep in Mind Christmas and other holidays will be coming up soon, and these will be great gifts!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in the place to contribute that is okay! You can greatly help by getting the word out to anyone that might be interested in helping contribute or even to spread the word even more!

story:
Short Summary

I am a multimedia artist working in oils,pastels,collage and fiber art. My life long love affair with the Mediterranean light,began began directly out of art school when I traveled to Southern France & Italy.
It is the magic of the light that inspires me to create landscapes that are both rich in color and texture.
Since my return from the Artist Residency program, in the summer of 2013, I have created a full body of work secured for a Solo Exhibit. It will be held on February 6th,2015, at the Gallery at Hillside Square, Montclair , NJ.,bringing the experience home.    
Many of the works require framing and all need to be photographed by my web photographer. The campaign funds will directly support this as well as covering the expense of the reception.
I want to thank everyone who backed my last campaign, that supported my traveling to the residency program. Now with your support I can take it all the way to the Opening of a Gallery Exhibition at Hillside Square.
The  Giclee print and the Throw pillow, are printed images of the work I created for this exhibit. The Silk Charmeuse Scarf, is created and hand printed by me. I create thermofax and deconstruction screens designed to reflect the images of nature.
 With your support the work will be beautifully installed and photographed. Save the date February, 6, 2015 and experience the reception. 

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story: Bonjour, je me présente: mon nom est Eric Braün, je suis un artiste et galiériste situé à Montréal, au Québec. Je m'occupe de la galerie d'art autogérée USINE 106U qui, depuis bientot 10 ans, présente une expo collective mensuelle regroupant une trentaine d'artistes. Depuis 2 ans, j'ai démarré le projet 106U MAGAZINE, une revue d'art trimestrielle de 32 pages couleur, format 9" X 12" tirée à 3000 exemplaires et distribuée gratuitement. Le tirage est entièrement financé par les publicités, qui sont de plus en plus difficiles à trouver, c'est pourquoi je fais appel à votre aide, pour pouvoir continuer ce projet bénévole et passionné qui permet de promouvoir l'art qui sort des sentiers battus. Pour ce 12e numéro, je choisis de rendre hommage à Nancy Ogilvie, une artiste-peintre autodidacte exceptionnelle; son talent prolifique génère des oeuvres sombres et expressives complexes et détaillées.
story_txt: Bonjour, je me présente: mon nom est Eric Braün, je suis un artiste et galiériste situé à Montréal, au Québec. Je m'occupe de la galerie d'art autogérée USINE 106U qui, depuis bientot 10 ans, présente une expo collective mensuelle regroupant une trentaine d'artistes. Depuis 2 ans, j'ai démarré le projet 106U MAGAZINE, une revue d'art trimestrielle de 32 pages couleur, format 9" X 12" tirée à 3000 exemplaires et distribuée gratuitement. Le tirage est entièrement financé par les publicités, qui sont de plus en plus difficiles à trouver, c'est pourquoi je fais appel à votre aide, pour pouvoir continuer ce projet bénévole et passionné qui permet de promouvoir l'art qui sort des sentiers battus. Pour ce 12e numéro, je choisis de rendre hommage à Nancy Ogilvie, une artiste-peintre autodidacte exceptionnelle; son talent prolifique génère des oeuvres sombres et expressives complexes et détaillées.

story:
Reflections Without Reservations

 

Hello,

 

My name is Nathaniel Bartels, Nate to my friends.

 

My upcoming book is based off of personal observations, contemplation, deliberations along with much study and research. The book has been many years in the making. The book explores an entirely different path of self-improvement. Instead of the mainstream position of positivity which currently dominates self-improvement, I've focused my research and writing on striking a life balance, developing tenacity and resilience, pursuing contentment and living your life realistically.

 

About Me

 

I am a writer who is (hopefully) achieving his life ambition of publishing his first book. Currently, my Bruce Wayne / Clark Kent alter-ego, day job is working for the United States Postal Service as a mail carrier in Massachusetts.

 

About the Project

 

This first book is the end result of over a decade of research, contemplation and personal observation. Much of my personal experiences with PTSD and Asperger's Syndrome are used throughout the book. This is the first of many books I am planning, and I am currently writing a second book to release hopefully in Spring 2017.  Considering my book is nearly finished, almost all of my research needs have already been met without significant financial penalty.

 

What remains, however, are publishing and production costs which I cannot meet on my own.

 

My goal is $3,700 which breaks down into the following:

 

$1,200 for Amazon self-publishing costs (formatting the manuscript to paperback and ebook, releasing book in both paperback and ebook simultaneously, etc.)

$1,200 for editing and assembly costs (including book cover and back from a graphic illustrator and paying for an editor)

$1,300 for marketing costs (printed books for the perks of donating, and publicity campaigns on Facebook, other marketing ideas, etc.)

 

My goal is to have the book published and available in the next three months.

 

What You Get For Donating

 

Firstly, if you’re willing to donate at least $30, there will be a limited production run of 100 signed copies of the copy made available after book release to be shipped anywhere in the world to you as my thanks for your help in reaching my goal.

 

Lastly, for those who who donate $50 or more, ten perks will be available, to not only send you an autographed copy of the book, but also put your name in the acknowledgements of my published book as thanks for giving towards my book being published.

 

(Note, the books will be sent once the book is published, this will be after the book is fully edited, formatted and posted for release on Amazon, estimated as being by the end of December 2016.)

 

Why This Project is Important

 

I feel as though a significant majority of people are not served by the current trend of positivity and positive thinking in self-improvement.  I’ve interviewed countless people and they would be interested in a self-improvement book which teaches balance, encourages contentment and above all, living your life realistically.  That’s what self-improvement should be about - looking at your life critically and realistically, not just self-validation.  After all, which would you rather have when you’re at a crossroads in your own life - something that tells you not to question yourself or a helpful suggestion that maybe your life isn’t working as well as you’d hoped and therein a pathway towards getting your life towards balance.

 

I have Asperger’s Syndrome and PTSD, either of which alone can be difficult, let alone debilitating, but having both has not only been life altering for me, and I want to give back to the world by offering my perspective and my own hard-won life lessons and personal observations.

 

I know that I am asking a lot of those who don't know me. My lifelong dream has been to publish a book, and I decided my first book will be on self-improvement as I believe my unique perspective will offer much to those not only with Asperger's Syndrome and PTSD, but much of society as well. I also feel that the book will change the perspective of society towards those on the Autism Spectrum.

 

Please Help!

 

If you are unable to contribute financially, please spread this campaign around to any interested parties. Use any and all share tools!

 

I already have a Facebook page up which I update frequently with my progress.

https://www.facebook.com/reflections.without.reservations/

 

Thank you very much for taking the time to look at my book project.  Hopefully we can work to put all the pieces together and get my book published!  

 

Yours Truly,

 

Nathaniel Bartels

story:
Introduction & Summary

This project aims to use the art of bodypainting to break down stereotypes and misconceptions about people with eating disorders, destigmatizing both the art form and the illness.

My name is Jessica Mellow, and I am a face painter, bodypainter, FX makeup artist, and bodypaint model based in NYC. I also have a history of severe eating disorders, which have manifested in nearly every form. While this monopolized my life for several years, making me believe it defined me, finding passion in art was a catalyst for change.  Though it is still a part of my life, the grip has loosened and allowed me to gain my life back and find an inner joy beyond what I thought possible.

February is Eating Disorders Awareness Month, so I figured it would be an ideal time to move forward with a project I've been contemplating for nearly two years. It is an issue I care deeply about, as it nearly killed me, and I've lost multiple friends to their own battles. My goal is to bodypaint a wide variety of people with eating disorders, using body art to help them express themselves.  This will allow them to tell their stories in a way that can help educate others, and break down misconceptions and stereotypes about those with EDs.  I will not exploit or dramatize anyone's experience or images, and body shape/size will NOT be the focus of the project. The comfort and well-being of the subjects will be the highest priority, and they will have final approval over their published photographs. The finished product will be a book with the images printed alongside each person's story.  In the meantime, you can follow the progress online. 

 The initial inspiration for this project is drawn from my first time as a human canvas (painted by a fellow painter and friend, Margie Nugent). It was for a short transformational video created by James Anthony McElligott, in which the bodypainting process is used as a way to show growth, healing, and bonding, fueled by the narration from our interviews and visualized through one of the most interactive and beautiful forms of art.  More about this particular project, my story, and the link to the video can be found here, in this note I wrote when the video was initially released in December 2010:

http://tinyurl.com/bsqz293

 

Where will the money go?

One of the first things I need to purchase is a professional level DSLR, as well as lenses and basic equipment.  I would like to do most of the photography myself, given the sensitive nature of the project, in order to keep the participants of the project as comfortable as possible.  However, throughout the process I will welcome assistance from other photographers, artists, editors, and graphic designers.  Any collaborators will be credited. 

The bulk of the funds will be used for travel, which will allow me to include people who wish to participate, but live further away.  Adding an international aspect will help in my goal of portraying the widest variety of people and stories possible, and allow me to show how eating disorders are experienced and perceived in other cultures. 

Though not the highest priority, an iPad would be helpful as a traveling portfolio, as well as to keep all aspects of the project organized and easily accessible at any time, anywhere.

Funding would also go toward costs of setting up and maintaining a website, and supplies such as paints, a new brush set, props, and accessories.  The paints I use are all FDA cosmetic compliant, made specifically for the skin.  I do not use any products on others that I do not use on myself, because one of the most important elements of this project is mutual trust and respect between the painter and model.  

Finally, once I have enough material, I will need to figure out the logistics of printing and publishing the finished product.  

All funds raised will be allocated to the project. In the meantime, I will continue pursuing freelance work to support myself, as I still have student loans, medical bills, rent, utilities, and other bills to pay.  Therefore, every little bit contributed will be immensely appreciated.

What do I hope to acheive? 

I want to bring awareness, understanding, and a new way of looking at an often stigmatized or glamorized illness through a form of art that may be viewed as somewhat controversial in the context. I want to educate people and make steps in eliminating stereotypes.  The constant misrepresentation of eating disorders which portray them as the result of extreme vanity, or a diet gone wrong, is dangerous. Those who are not educated about EDs still often group everyone with the label into one box. Worse, they group only those with a certain set of symptoms or a certain appearance into a box and end up overlooking the majority of people suffering from EDs. Mental illness is blind to color/class/age, but the stereotypes keep people who don’t fit the mold from seeking much-needed help. 

I will represent people across the spectrum in all aspects including age, race, class, culture, gender, profession, and manifestation of the illness (anorexia, bulimia, binge eating, compulsive overeating, night eating syndrome, exercise bulimia, diabulimia, pica, bigorexia, EDNOS), past or present.

As bodypaint still carries somewhat of a stigma itself, I hope that combining these two elements will help reduce that stigma, show people a way to see the human body as a work of art in itself, open up dialogue, and even help reduce the body-shaming that is so prevalent in today's society.

Most of all, I want to foster hope.  Hope for recovery, and hope for life, because life is really a beautiful thing.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that many people don't have money to contribute, but if you could share this with someone you think would want to contribute or even someone who may not be able to contribute but would be interested in following the project or participating, it would be great. 

If you have something you would like to donate, such as frequent flier miles, equipment, or services, it would also be greatly appreciated.

Last but not least, THANK YOU (especially for reading, if you made it this far)!!!

story:
About us and the Plant Spirit Oracle:

Enter the amazing world of plant spirit medicine with the Plant Spirit Oracle!  The Plant Spirit Oracle is a 50-card oracle deck that is 3.5x5.5" in size (large size).  This wonderful deck introduces you to some of North America’s most powerful healing plant allies. This deck was hand-painted by Dana O'Driscoll, author and illustrator of The Tarot of Trees published in 2009 and Archdruid of Water in the Ancient Order of Druids in America.  Dana is also the author of the Druid's Garden Blog (druidgarden.wordpress.com).

The deck will be printed full color and borderless at 3.5x5.5".  It will come with a rigid tuck box.  Optionally, to learn to use the deck more fully, you can also purchase the Plant Spirit Oracle Companion book. The book offers a wealth of information about the plants in the series: divination meanings, identification and ecology information, herbalism and herbal recipes and crafts. In addition to unique card spreads and how to use the Plant Spirit Oracle as a divination system, the book features a chapter on advanced work that covers ritual uses, plant spirit communication and plant spirit journeying. Additionally, it covers information practicing herbalism and how to successfully grow and prepare a variety of plant medicines.

 

The Oracle includes seven "guilds" with overarching themes (similar to the "suits" in the Tarot).  The Guilds, themes, and specific cards are listed here:

Guild: Great Principles of Nature ; Theme: Connectivity

Cards: The Great Web, The Land Within and Without, Regeneration, Earth, Air, Fire, Water

Guild: The Forest ; Theme: Metaphysical

Black Cohosh, Elder (Elk), Ghost Pipe, Hawthorn, Wild Yam, Turkey Tail

Guild: The Water's Edge; Theme: Relationship

Blue Vervain, Calamus, Eastern Hemlock, Jewelweed, Mugwort, Reishi, Witch Hazel

Guild: The Lawn; Theme: Receptivity

All Heal, Burdock, Chickweed, Dandelion, Ground Ivy, Plantain, Yarrow

Guild: The Field; Theme: Projectivity

Catnip, Goldenrod, New England Aster, Staghorn Sumac, Spruce, St. John’s Wort, Tobacco

Guild: The Garden; Theme: Physical

Apple, Bay Laurel, Cannabis, Comfrey, Monarda, Motherwort, Rosemary

Guild: Planet Warriors; Theme: Disharmony

Black Raspberry, Blackberry, Elder (Aeld Mother), Japanese Knotweed, Multiflora Rose, Poison Ivy, Stinging Nettle

More information about the PSO and more images can be found on our website: http://www.plantspiritoracle.com 

Briel Driscoll, Dana's sister and a fellow herbalist is helping her with this campaign. She is enthusiastic to help get this deck in print and help spread knowledge on plants here in the Northeastern United States. 

 

What is the money for:

All of the money raised for this campaign will be used to publish, print and ship the PSO to help us get it into your hands! The new 50-card deck will come in a hard box and will be in full color. In addition, you can select a contribution level that works best for you to receive other goodies, including original paintings from the Oracle, readings from Dana, and much more!

 

What is the timeline:

This campaign will conclude in late October.  From there, we will finalize our print run and have our cards printed.  The decks and other perks will be in your hands by February 2020.

 

Other ways you can help:

Spread the word about this campaign and the deck in general! Share on social media.  Tell your friends and help us raise the funds to bring this deck to the world!

story:
Dans la scène culturelle et artistique montréalaise, SOIR est une bibitte, nous a certifié l’entomologue Jean-Benoît Duval. En raison de sa nature effervescente et chaotique, à mi-chemin entre une foire et un festival, le projet n’entre dans aucun cadre institutionnel de financement. SOIR est l’un des seuls événements pluridisciplinaires qui favorise autant la présence d’artistes émergents et le dialogue entre les différents acteurs de la communauté qui l’héberge, le temps d’un soir. En offrant en grande majorité d’activités gratuites, SOIR désire rester petit et conserver son approche DIY, accessible et intime.

Le projet existe déjà grâce à la générosité de nombreux bénévoles, amis et collaborateurs qui donnent leur temps et leur énergie à la pelle! Cependant, il reste des frais de production d’environ 5000$ à couvrir pour l’édition SOIR 2017 HOCHELAGA-MAISONNEUVE. Ces dépenses incluent la réalisation des vidéos de présentation des commerces et des artistes par des réalisateurs.trices émergent.e.s, les frais associés aux photographes, à l’aménagement du site (montage, accrochage, démontage), à l’impression d’affiches et de pamphlets, la location d’équipement de son, la sécurité, les permis d’alcool et d’occupation de l’espace public.

Étant donné qu’il s’agit de la première édition dans le quartier Hochelaga-Maisonneuve, il est plus difficile de convaincre les gens que c’est une bonne idée de nous financer! L’année dernière, nous avions lancé une campagne de financement populaire pour la première édition dans Rosemont-La Petite-Patrie et c’est grâce à votre générosité que nous sommes parvenus à réaliser notre projet un peu débile! Ayant eu un minimum de budget, nous avons eu une très belle réception et avons su montrer que nous sommes capables de belles choses! Dans Hochelaga, comme c’est la première édition, il faut repartir à presque zéro et refaire ce processus.

Le projet existe déjà grâce à la générosité de nombreux bénévoles, amis et collaborateurs qui donnent leur temps et leur énergie à la pelle! Cependant, il reste des frais de production d’environ 5000$ à couvrir pour l’édition SOIR 2017 HOCHELAGA-MAISONNEUVE. Ces dépenses incluent la réalisation des vidéos de présentation des commerces et des artistes par des réalisateurs.trices émergent.e.s, les frais associés aux photographes, à l’aménagement du site (montage, accrochage, démontage), à l’impression d’affiches et de pamphlets, la location d’équipement de son, la sécurité, les permis d’alcool et d’occupation de l’espace public.
Étant donné qu’il s’agit de la première édition dans le quartier Hochelaga-Maisonneuve, il est plus difficile de convaincre les gens que c’est une bonne idée de nous financer! L’année dernière, nous avions lancé une campagne de financement populaire pour la première édition dans Rosemont-La Petite-Patrie et c’est grâce à votre générosité que nous sommes parvenus à réaliser notre projet un peu débile! Ayant eu un minimum de budget, nous avons eu une très belle réception et avons su montrer que nous sommes capables de belles choses! Dans Hochelaga, comme c’est la première édition, il faut repartir à presque zéro et refaire ce processus.

story:
Summary

My name is Graham Sheen and I am looking for funding to run my very first solo art exhibition in 2015 at the rooftop gallery in Corby.

    I live in Northamptonshire with my daughter. I find this helps me to keep active, creative and never in the same place, as anyone with children will know it keeps you busy. I have been an artist for nearly 10 years and mainly work in mixed media including pins, wood chip, denim and basically any material I can find. Taking inspiration from artists such as Phillip Sutton, Jackson Pollock and Dilorenzo my work has no rules. one piece completed in 2012 was made with over 26000 map pins. 

    The money raised will help me to fund my first exhibition, which as any artist will know, is always the toughest, most nerve racking and hardest to fund.

    With costs of Gallery hire locally starting at £400 for 4 weeks, advertising & promotional costs and the costs of the opening night, drinks and programmes the money is extremely difficult to find.

    However, once an exhibition has been done, the rewards can be great.

    Personally, it would be a huge step and opportunity in my art career to hold this exhibition.


      What Is Needed & What You Get

      Break down

      • My aim is to raise £1500 to fund this project and the costs are shown below.
      • Gallery hire for 4 weeks is £400, Newspaper, posters and promotional material has been cost at £375, additional staff hire for set up is £200, opening night drinks and nibbles for up to 100 people is £500

      For a £1 donation, you will have your name in the THANKS section of the official programme, £5 will get your name in the programme and I will also send you your own personal copy,
      £45 will get you your name in the programme as well as your own copy and an invite to the opening night and for £150 you will receive your name in the programme, along with your own copy, an invite to the opening night and an original personal portrait.

        If i don't reach the £1500 target then the funds raised will still go towards the planned exhibition. some additional funds (if any) will be given to a local charity and Diabetes UK.

           
          Risks & Challenges

           If the funds required are not reached then an exhibit can still be held but the venue may need to be changed and it may be for a shorter time, but hopefully the full exhibit can be achieved.

          Other Ways You Can Help

          Please spread the word about this campaign and help to make this happen.

          For further information on my art, please go to www.sheenart.co.uk


          Many thanks

story:
All donations to Bedrock Art Editions are TAX DEDUCTIBLE.


Technology makes it possible for us to crank out digital copies of an artist's work in the same amount of time it takes to make a sandwich.


But for discerning artists, collectors, and appreciators of art, there is no replacement for the centuries-old craft of hand printing, whether it be lithography, woodcut or etchings. 

Call lithography a "dying art" if you must, but those who understand printmaking value the hours of labor and craft that go into a fine, hand-printed edition of an artist's original works.

There is no button pushing. There are no shortcuts. The outcome is breathtaking.


Fine art lithography in particular is an intimate conversation between artist and printer, stone and paper, light and color. It is laborious and complex and worth waiting for. 


My name is Aaron Shipps, and I'm a collaborative, fine art printer. I've worked hard at my craft (first at the world-renowned Tamarind Institute, and most recently at the Lawrence Lithography Workshop), and I'm proud to have had work I've printed displayed in venues such as The Smithsonian, MOMA, The Nelson Atkins, and much more. My commitment to my life's work could fairly be called "obsessional," and it's my hope that it shows in the prints that I make.

"Aaron is a superbly skilled lithographer and a dream to work and collaborate with. When I was working on a lithographic print at Tamarind and there were some slow times for me, Aaron talked me into collaborating on a series of offset lithographs and it was one of the most wonderful and valuable impromptu projects I have done. Aaron was very encouraging, great listener, and worked like a fiend. I cannot recommend him more strongly—he truly is the master of his work."


-Tanja Softić, Professor of Art, University of Richmond


Armed with a strong desire to approach printmaking in a fresh, innovative way, I'm opening a new fine art print shop, Bedrock Art Editions, LLC, in Kansas City's Crossroads Arts District.


It's my desire to realize vibrant new works by contemporary artists using innovative twists of these old print mediums. And because my doors are open to all artists, I envision the shop as a creative asset and curious destination for the community at large.

 Here's what's already in place:

With the sale of my printers proofs, the generosity of supportive friends and family like Mike Lyon, Ben Worth, Dave and Nancy Shipps, Joe Valley, Aimee Eckhardt, Cheri LeBlond, and so many more—plus the fastidious squirreling away of every last available penny— the following is already in place:

  • A large, motor-driven lithography press
  • An exposure unit
  • Chemicals, solvents, and A LOT of misc. materials
  • A full array of drawing supplies and artists tools
  • Specialized shop tables and furniture
  • A BEAUTIFUL studio space secured down town in Kansas City's Crossroads Arts District (shown below)


Some exciting projects are already lining up, including an ambitious 100-color lithograph with Kansas City artist, Laura Berman. To put that into perspective for the layperson, an average litho today is made of about 5-6 colors. Below is Laura's sketch of this incredible project.


 

Though we're close to opening the doors, we've still got some critical needs:


  • Lithography Stones: $1,950
  • Papers: $2,130
  • Inks: $1,588 
  • Printing Plates: $3,044 
  • Rollers: $2,077 FULLY FUNDED!
  • Scraper bars for the press, tympyns, gum arabic, etc.: $3,214 FULLY FUNDED!
  • Remaining shop buildout: $1,000 FULLY FUNDED!
TOTAL: $15,000


How you can make a TAX DEDUCTIBLE contribution:


  • Contribute here via credit card. Each and every tax-deductible dollar translates directly into equipment, stones, and materials for the shop.
  • Purchase art! I am releasing my collection of printers proofs from well-regarded artists, including Roger Shimomura, Andrzej Zeilinski, Zigmunds Priede, Mike Lyon, Anthony Baab, and more. Visit my online gallery to view them all. I am offering a 20% discount for those who purchase a piece through this campaign. All sales go directly to fund the shop.
Please note that while there are suggested giving levels, with gifts involved, you may contribute any amount you wish, all tax deductible!
In advance, I truly thank you for your support. I am looking forward to building a shop that will become a long-standing creative asset both here in Kansas City and nationally. And when I do, I will have you to thank.
 

Aaron Shipps / Tamarind Master Printer

Bedrock Art Editions Owner


Bedrock Art Editions is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Bedrock Art Editions must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” only.
