story:
Our atelier is a place for artistic collaboration and creation, a place to share ideas. 
We wish to show that art and beauty can invade every moment of our daily life and finally change the world. Original creations, exhibitions, performances, workshops are serving our goal in order to make the community grow.

We believe that creativity can  be activated at any moment in life. Bleu Avant-Garde is not only an atelier, we are trying to create a new artistic mouvement that include everyone - official artists or not. We consider life as a canvas where we are all free to express ourselves regarding our own sensibilities. Quality is seen with subjectivity. It is achieve when someone is acting as free as possible. Free from social boundaries but more than everything free from any personal blocks.


We want to offer a place for artists and lovers of creation, as well as promote lifestyles and choices according to our philosophy (such as using eco friendly supplies). The concept is simple : a  room with a warm atmosphere, where everybody feels good and can express himself through creative moments..

Every day, during opening hours, people can share a table and work on their own draft. More than a co-working space, our aim is to give the possibility to share and exchange our experiences and fulfill our arty minds, maybe find other artists to collaborate on creative projects. That is why we offer our space to artists and curators who want to propose shows that fit our philosophy: we wish to generate collaborations that involve other enterprises, artists or individuals.

From those collaborations will come out events, product designs and art exhibitions that would give the possibility to experience art during special moments. We will also act as a collective aiming to give all projects a bigger voice.

During holidays and weekends, the artist Fannie Faivre will also lead some workshops for adults or children, or both, on different themes according to the sensibility of the moment. It would be a way to enhance everyone inner power of creation.



Bleu Avant-Garde this is Fannie Faivre.

Fannie Faivre is animating the workshops at Bleu Avant-Garde Atelier. She graduated from Fine Arts in Paris. Her aim is to keep a poetic vision in everything she does. She began as a painter and illustrator,  and is now using her artistic skills to share a different vision of Art with people. Surrounded by her family and friends, she has opened the Bleu Avant Garde Atelier in Berlin as an open window to free creativity.

"I am interested in the process of creation. Whatever the result you have, it's the emotions you put inside and the way you do it that is important for me. Art is not only in museums, but mainly in you, in everything you do".

Visit her website : http://fanniefaivre.weebly.com/



Bleu Avant-Garde this is also Marion Rogers.

Marion has discover the arts quite late in her life and she was delighted every second since. Her goal is to promote art and culture by engaging fruitful collaborations between artists and to bring more people to feel art in themselves. She is acting as an agent for emerging artists in order to help them to find their own voice and to promote themselves more clearly. She would like more people to live surrounded with art. She is acting to develop the art market for everyone, artists and collectors.

She is involved in the counseling agency La Conciergerie. 

http://lacococo.weebly.com/


In order to give our reality life, we will need your support. There is nothing we could do on our own and because we absolutely need you to adhere to our project, we decided to start a crowdfunding campaign.

The money we raise will allow us to order supplies from ecological enterprises (paints, papers, canvas and others materials), to prepare our atelier in a way that will allow creativity to flow, assuring secure experience to children, clear mind to parents and a good space for creation. 

It will also allow us to pay the artists involved in the collaboration for the work done.


The different contributions :

* €5 EUR - Birds are singing thank you !

Our eternal gratitude and your name in the "Special Thanks" section on our website !

* €20 EUR - Magic wings.

A limited edition postcard Bleu Avant-Garde, made by the artist Fannie Faivre. It will be send to your personal address or the address of your choice with a special word thought for you.


*€35 EUR - Color Bleu in pink.

Our eternal gratitude, a Bleu Avant-Garde's postcard 

AND 

a notebook Bleu Avant-Garde with illustrations from Fannie Faivre. Drawings printed on recycled paper with cardboard cover.


* €50 EUR - Eyes wide open.

Our eternal gratitude, a Bleu Avant-Garde's postcard 

AND 

a limited reproduction of Fannie’s artwork (choose between 3 watercolor painting), numbered and personally signed for you. Printed on good quality A3 paper. Only available through this campaign.


* €80 EUR - Walk with a smile.

Our eternal gratitude, a Bleu Avant-Garde's postcard 

AND 

a tote bag, hand painted by Fannie Faivre. Ink on 100% cotton canvas. Art to carry with you and bring magic everywhere.


* €150 EUR - Happy walls.

Our eternal gratitude, a Bleu Avant-Garde's postcard 

AND 

a predrawn painting from Fannie Faivre. The shape is hand painted with china ink on canvas 1,20m x 0,80 m. You are invited to color it yourself with the painting kit (gouache set and a pencil  brush) we provide. Suitable for both adults and children.


* €280 EUR - Take more cake.

Our eternal gratitude, a Bleu Avant-Garde's postcard  

AND  

A little artist overall jumper made on 100% cotton canvas by the designer Cléa Jacob. This simple and comfortable clothe will allow your child to express his creativity with freedom of movement and protection from color stains 

AND 

A predrawn painting from Fannie Faivre. The shape is hand painted with china ink on canvas 1,20m x 0,80 m. You are invited to color it with the painting kit (gouache set and a pencil brush) we provide.


* €300 EUR - View from the moon.

Our eternal gratitude, a Bleu Avant-Garde's postcard  
AND 
An airy artwork specially made for you by the artist Fannie Faivre. The Art Mobile is made with sticks of wood and suspending elements whom the shapes, colors and mobility have been chosen to create an unique moment of magic in your home. dimension around 50x50cm. Every Art Mobile is unique and tell its own story.

* €500 EUR - A bigger taste of Bleu.


Our eternal gratitude, a Bleu Avant-Garde's postcard  

AND 

Unique jacket, with hand painted fabric from Fannie Faivre, hand-made by the designer Cléa Jacob. The shape stay the same while the abstract drawing is each time different. When you order one jacket, we produce it with your own size. The jacket is only produce on demand which make it special for the owner. 

 OR 

A all day long children birthday party at Bleu Avant-Garde, included creative workshop, outside painting, birthdays cakes from Jojo, drinks, artistic games with 20 little friends. Documented by a photographer.


* €1,000 EUR - Open your window...

Our eternal gratitude, a Bleu Avant-Garde's postcard  
AND 
An original painting from the artist Fannie Faivre, Made on 1,20 m x 0,80 m canvas with ink, watercolor, china ink and maybe more... The canvas will be inspired by a text you can write to the artist on this occasion. Open to special demands (bigger size,...). More ideas : http://fanniefaivre.weebly.com/

Marion has discover the arts quite late in her life and she was delighted every second since. Her goal is to promote art and culture by engaging fruitful collaborations between artists and to bring more people to feel art in themselves. She is acting as an agent for emerging artists in order to help them to find their own voice and to promote themselves more clearly. She would like more people to live surrounded with art. She is acting to develop the art market for everyone, artists and collectors.
She is involved in the counseling agency La Conciergerie. 
http://lacococo.weebly.com/

In order to give our reality life, we will need your support. There is nothing we could do on our own and because we absolutely need you to adhere to our project, we decided to start a crowdfunding campaign.
The money we raise will allow us to order supplies from ecological enterprises (paints, papers, canvas and others materials), to prepare our atelier in a way that will allow creativity to flow, assuring secure experience to children, clear mind to parents and a good space for creation. 
It will also allow us to pay the artists involved in the collaboration for the work done.




The different contributions :
* €5 EUR - Birds are singing thank you !
Our eternal gratitude and your name in the "Special Thanks" section on our website !
* €20 EUR - Magic wings.
A limited edition postcard Bleu Avant-Garde, made by the artist Fannie Faivre. It will be send to your personal address or the address of your choice with a special word thought for you.

*€35 EUR - Color Bleu in pink.
Our eternal gratitude, a Bleu Avant-Garde's postcard 
AND 
a notebook Bleu Avant-Garde with illustrations from Fannie Faivre. Drawings printed on recycled paper with cardboard cover.

* €50 EUR - Eyes wide open.


Our eternal gratitude, a Bleu Avant-Garde's postcard 
AND 
a limited reproduction of Fannie’s artwork (choose between 3 watercolor painting), numbered and personally signed for you. Printed on good quality A3 paper. Only available through this campaign.

* €80 EUR - Walk with a smile.


Our eternal gratitude, a Bleu Avant-Garde's postcard 
AND 
a tote bag, hand painted by Fannie Faivre. Ink on 100% cotton canvas. Art to carry with you and bring magic everywhere.

* €150 EUR - Happy walls.


Our eternal gratitude, a Bleu Avant-Garde's postcard 
AND 
a predrawn painting from Fannie Faivre. The shape is hand painted with china ink on canvas 1,20m x 0,80 m. You are invited to color it yourself with the painting kit (gouache set and a pencil  brush) we provide. Suitable for both adults and children.

* €280 EUR - Take more cake.


Our eternal gratitude, a Bleu Avant-Garde's postcard  
AND  
A little artist overall jumper made on 100% cotton canvas by the designer Cléa Jacob. This simple and comfortable clothe will allow your child to express his creativity with freedom of movement and protection from color stains 
AND 
A predrawn painting from Fannie Faivre. The shape is hand painted with china ink on canvas 1,20m x 0,80 m. You are invited to color it with the painting kit (gouache set and a pencil brush) we provide.

* €300 EUR - View from the moon.


Our eternal gratitude, a Bleu Avant-Garde's postcard  

AND 

An airy artwork specially made for you by the artist Fannie Faivre. The Art Mobile is made with sticks of wood and suspending elements whom the shapes, colors and mobility have been chosen to create an unique moment of magic in your home. dimension around 50x50cm.  Every Art Mobile is unique and tell its own story.


* €500 EUR - A bigger taste of Bleu.


Our eternal gratitude, a Bleu Avant-Garde's postcard  
AND 






Unique jacket, with hand painted fabric from Fannie Faivre, hand-made by the designer Cléa Jacob. The shape stay the same while the abstract drawing is each time different. When you order one jacket, we produce it with your own size. The jacket is only produce on demand which make it special for the owner. 
 OR 


A all day long children birthday party at Bleu Avant-Garde, included creative workshop, outside painting, birthdays cakes from Jojo, drinks, artistic games with 20 little friends. Documented by a photographer.

* €1,000 EUR - Open your window...


Our eternal gratitude, a Bleu Avant-Garde's postcard  

AND 

An original painting from the artist Fannie Faivre, Made on 1,20 m x 0,80 m canvas with ink, watercolor, china ink and maybe more...  The canvas will be inspired by a text you can write to the artist on this occasion.   Open to special demands (bigger size,...). More ideas : http://fanniefaivre.weebly.com/

story:
Who We Are

We are an alternative music and urban culture online publication operated from Toronto with contributors in Montreal, Chicago, New York and Baltimore.

QUIP has been around for just a little bit over a year. During this year we went from a team of 2 to a team of 30, shared over 200 original stories, and helped multiple independent artist come a little bit closer to fame for doing what they love.

Why We Need Your Help

As a magazine that started out from passion for music and culture we are not driven by profits. Our community consists of writers, photographers, illustrators, designers, and editors who contribute for free because they love what they do and get a chance to exercise their craft while gaining priceless exposure that helps them get better jobs.

Our ultimate goal is to be able to compensate the contributors for all of their fantastic work while giving exposure to up and coming musicians, visual artists and filmmakers.

The next step for QUIP is to attract advertisers in order to be able to pay our well deserving contributors but there are a few issues that prevent us from getting there.

One of our current biggest obstacle is the fact that our server is shared with the entirety of the internet making our loading speeds incredibly slow which drives away a lot of readers and potential advertisers.

What We Are Looking For

We are asking you to help us fund a dedicated server - this would allow us to have our own dedicated space on the internet making it easier for people to get to the content they are looking for right away.

The $2,000 we are asking for will allow us to have a level 3 dedicated server for a year (100GB storage, 4GB dedicated RAM  and 2TB network transfer).

The Impact

On the long run this simple improvement would get us closer to becoming a self sustaining publication that continues to promote talented independent artists and musicians.

Other Ways You Can Help

The simplest way you can help us is to give us a chance - check out our site, visit out Facebook page, follow us on Twitter - we might just be a publication you will develop a regular reading relationship with.  

If you can’t contribute please share the project with your social community, maybe one of them can.

Ways We Can Help You

We are always looking for new contributors and interesting people to talk about, if you are a musician, an artist, a filmmaker, a writer, or a photographer interested in working with us or gaining exposure please visit our Submissions page.



Cover image by Brandon Farrington
